programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan Hatfield and Ellie Beardmore look at a dazzling diamond-encrusted mobile phone, a rare German clock, a stunning diamond cluster ring and a solid silver Rococo-style bowl. At Nikolas Patrick in London, pawnbroking brothers Charlie and Patrick Devine consider deals on Harry Potter's broomstick and an impressive collection of Manchester United memorabilia.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick Pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick inspect a collection of boxing memorabilia owned by former boxing promoter Kellie Maloney, as well as an unusual electric unicycle. At London Road in Sheffield, Dan has a diamond encrusted bracelet in his sights, and is also considering deals on two high-end leather belts and a huge collection of coins featuring some of the world's most dangerous creatures.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Surrey, where Susie and Andy Clark's house is set to be demolished. However, the couple are still looking for a new home after 18 months of searching. Meanwhile, first-time buyers Sam Summers and Jess Jeary have a firm idea of what they want, but need help turning their dreams into a reality.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer visits the town of Bradford-on-Avon in Wiltshire, where Ghika and Ronnie Coyle have been searching for the perfect property for 10 years. Also in the South West, Kirstie Allsopp helps cautious first-time buyers Mark and Ellie Devine look for a home in Bristol.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi help Louisa and Julian, who want to move from their one-bedroom house in Middlesex to a more spacious home in south Devon on a budget of £260,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, where owner Sarah Summers is dreading the arrival of Robert after their confrontation.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Events manager Peter Ferguson hosts the first party in Edinburgh, but his guests are less than impressed with his pricey chateaubriand main course. After a gospel choir provides the evening's entertainment, one guest finds herself in trouble, leaving another diner speechless.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alison Lynch hosts the dinner party in Edinburgh, and attempts to win her guests over with a ju-jitsu-themed evening. Rena Martin appears to be endearing herself to the group, and Cynthia Gentle impresses Gary Reid by telling him what she can do with a mango.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beautician Cynthia Gentle hopes to win over her guests with a theme of 1950s glamour and an international menu, featuring a main course that includes crocodile, as she hosts the third dinner party in Edinburgh. Security firm boss Gary Reid decides to provoke a debate on fidelity, while tensions erupt between ju-jitsu teacher Alison Lynch and events manager Peter Ferguson.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Health worker Rena Martin opts for a decadent menu as she hosts the fourth dinner party in Edinburgh, but the rowdy atmosphere proves too much for one of the guests, who ends up asking for a taxi home.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Security manager Gary Reid hosts the final dinner party in Edinburgh, and installs cameras in his dining room to ensure he caters for his guests' needs. Alison Lynch and Peter Ferguson continue to argue, but tensions are forgotten over a cracker-eating game, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the conclusion of Gordon Ramsay's visit to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, he confronts sisters Rita and Lisa with an ultimatum, and finds himself stuck in a war between the waiters, chefs and owners over who is to blame for the Italian restaurant's failings.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, where he meets a stubborn owner who doesn't react well to criticism. Tom bought the restaurant for his daughter Andrea, but six years later he's still refusing to let her run it. Can the chef break Tom's iron grip on the business and persuade him to change his outdated approach?.(n)

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: George Clarke returns to Harrogate, North Yorkshire, to check on the progress of Carol and Majid Nadry, who after 25 years living in a bungalow, embarked on an ambitious midlife adventure - buying a water tower to turn into a five-storey home. After huge delays and eye-watering legal costs, the couple have finally built the two-storey extension that was the key to creating a family home with character. George sees how the industrial heritage of this unique building is beautifully complemented by a 21st-century glass and sheet-metal extension that finally realises the old water tower's hidden potential.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt are joined by guest presenter Kiran Jethwa to investigate the latest dietary trends and scientific advances in the world of weight loss. In Los Angeles, Kate looks into reports that caffeine could be a powerful weapon in the battle of the bulge, while Jimmy heads to Belgium on the trail of chocolate that is packed with bacteria that are supposed to keep people healthy.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Professional singer Precious seeks romance with amateur magician Earle. The restaurant also welcomes company director John, who hopes fellow Scot Greig is the man he can settle down with. And fellow diner Hebe is on the verge of giving up on finding Mr Right. Hopefully she will connect with fine wine merchant Charles.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Ladies' man Luke, 30, is ready to give up playing the field and is searching for the one. His date is 29-year-old PR manager Sophie. Tired of turning up to weddings alone, she's looking for a man to become her 'plus-one' in life. The restaurant also welcomes Bristolian mother of three Mandy, whose date is 52-year-old landscape gardener Andrew.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he earlier tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or fallen by the wayside. First he visits the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, then heads to California to see the owners of Kingston Cafe, French-themed La Frite, and Capri.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Wilkinsburg in Pennsylvania, home to Ms Jean's Southern Cuisine, which was opened by retired special-education teacher Jean Gould. During the chef's attempt to save the business from disaster, he discovers her soul-food restaurant resembles a dentist's waiting room and finds a lot of tension between Jean and her employees, who claim she is a Jekyll-and-Hyde character.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Midwife Sarah and partner Stephen look forward to the arrival of their twins at Liverpool Women's Hospital. Cameras also follow young couple Holly and Nick, who surprised her mum Michelle by announcing their planned pregnancy. Meanwhile, Tasha and Jonny come in to have their second child after a traumatic birth with their first baby, Nevaeh.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: In America, the waters of Lake Erie turn pea green, while a man in New Zealand finds eels swimming in his street after a sudden and violent downpour. A photographer captures rare images of a moustache cloud, New York City grinds to a halt as onlookers witness the beautiful sunset known as `Manhattanhenge', and in Hawaii, volcanic lava creates tornados of steam on the ocean surface. A terrifying mudslide roars through a sleepy Austrian village, while wind and rain carve ancient rocks into giant mushroom-like shapes in Egypt.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. Single mum Tracy from Bedfordshire has been out of the dating game since she split with her fiancee three years ago and hopes to find a man who matches her adventurous side, while London sales advisor Matthew, 24, is tired of dating apps and thinks online profiles mean girls never actually see the real him. Anna Richardson hosts.(n)

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets Grimsby barman Lewis, who is calling time on a troublesome tattoo of Henry the Hoover above his private parts. The programme also features body modification jewellery designer Jenya, who has plans for stretching, and comic book artist Louis, who wants to brand his latest work onto his skin. Plus, a Christian fishmonger who regrets a Jesus inking meets a model planning to have a monster skeletal moth tattooed across her chest.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Comfort Food Bites
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver gives some of the nation's favourite dishes a twist, creating the ultimate toasted cheese sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou gets stopped in his tracks test driving a £30,000 Radical racing car, memorabilia expert Lawrence Pickett deals with an intriguing enquiry about a piece of pop art, while handbag expert Claudia Valentin is moved to tears by a client with an emotional story. James also values a tiara belonging to a martial arts fan, which could be worth £40,000.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Deals on the table today include a cross between a motorbike and a boat, rare vintage champagne, an unusual mechanical calculator, and an Aboriginal weapon known as a nulla nulla.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to north-west England, where Richard and Helen Francis have been experiencing the city-centre lifestyle in Manchester. However, with a baby on the way, they are looking to move to the suburbs on a budget of £400,000. In Preston, Graham and Nina Walker hope to swap their tiny rented terraced house for their first marital home.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The East Midlands is the focus of this week's house-hunting, as Kirstie Allsopp joins Sam and Becky, who have a £100,000 budget and are looking for a house in Nottingham with a sizeable plot of land. Phil Spencer is with Nigel and Jane, who sold their home in Australia and moved back to the UK when Nigel was diagnosed with early onset dementia. But despite being back for months, they have struggled to find a property that lives up to expectations.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Coastal enthusiast David Bull and countryside fan Kirsty Duffy advise a couple wishing to invest £300,000 in a property in East Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day in the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. The Brighton Surf Hotel is first up and hosts Jeremy and Elena Mann want to defend their no-breakfast remote-hosting concept.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Club owner and millionaire Vernal Aley hosts the first in a week of parties on the Wirral, Merseyside, inviting feminist and student Candida Darling, party girl Chrissy Griffin, chicken enthusiast Adele Richards and project manager Stuart Leake to dinner.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Feminist and student Candida Darling continues the challenge on the Wirral. The views she holds on Vernal Aley's lap-dancing business are questioned when the guests discover a set of revealing pictures, but the night ends in good spirits.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Chicken enthusiast Adele Richards intends to use an abundance of home-grown ingredients, including freshly laid eggs, when she hosts the third party on the Wirral. Unfortunately, her efforts are overshadowed by the amount of cat hair her guests find in the food - a situation Chrissy Griffin finds immensely amusing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Chrissy Griffin hosts the fourth dinner party on the Wirral, Merseyside, hoping to win over her guests with a Caribbean menu and a group of Spanish troubadours. However, tensions soon boil over and one of the party storms out.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Project manager Stuart Leake hosts the final dinner party on the Wirral and hopes to bring harmony to the group with a 1920s-themed event. He also gives a demonstration of his piano playing, before the contestants discover who will be taking home the prize money.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Brooklyn, New York, to tackle a 55-year-old family business. Owner John Esposito left school at the age of 14 and has worked at his parents' restaurant, Sal's Pizzeria, ever since. Their success meant they could afford to purchase the location next door in the 1990s, naming it Mama Maria after John's mother, who died in 2002. But when he lost his father as well, John became overwhelmed by the responsibility of running both establishments and his livelihood is at risk.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Beaver, Pennsylvania, where he meets a brother-and-sister team who find it almost impossible to work together. Their relationship is so fractured that they're failing to save their father's Italian restaurant from being overwhelmed by local competition, and the situation has become so desperate that their dad is in danger of losing his life savings.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Hampshire, where former naval officer Colin Nugent and wife Gillian are hoping to buy their first home after 23 years of marriage and 12 relocations with the military. Meanwhile, Army captain Ian Bellamy will be leaving the forces and is looking for a new house with girlfriend Diane Pittard.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Labrador is rushed to Fitzpatrick's unable to stand, and although Professor Noel Fitzpatrick tells the family that surgery is not an option, his team devises an alternative care plan. The vets also treat a bichon frise suffering chronic elbow pain, and a leonberger has a bone tumour removed from its leg after being diagnosed with cancer.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman is airlifted to hospital after being involved in a road traffic collision, with consultants concerned that she may have life-threatening internal bleeding. Meanwhile, 80-year-old Mohammad has come to A&E after falling at home during a family Eid celebratory feast, and 56-year-old Russ is brought in after falling from a ladder while cutting back some trees at work.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: New series. Return of the documentary that follows the work of Bedfordshire Police around the clock as they investigate a number of major crimes. In the first edition, a man emerges from a hotel lift covered in blood and holding a fire extinguisher, before approaching the reception desk and shouting that he has killed someone. Cameras follow every twist and turn as detectives try to work out what really happened at the hotel close to Luton Airport, which has suddenly become a chaotic and bloody crime scene.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan: The Out Out Tour
programme.desc: A performance by the comedian from his sold-out nationwide tour. He tells the story of his upbringing in London's East End and his rise to fame, making observations about the British class system along the way.(n)

programme.title: Baby Ballroom
programme.desc: The young dancers try on dresses, have their make-up done and choose new dancing shoes ahead of a prestigious competition in Essex, which is particularly important for Andrei, whose father Ovi has travelled all the way from Romania for the event.(n)

programme.title: Gypsy Kids: Our Secret World
programme.desc: The first in a three-part documentary series exploring childhood in Gypsy and traveller communities, beginning with an introduction to 12-year-old Oliver, who has already learned to drive, but believes his true vocation in life lies with horses. Also featured are 13-year-old aspiring model Sylvanna, who must decide whether to take a lucrative contract or preserve her identity, and eight-year-old Margaret, who might jeopardise a sparkling academic career should she choose to follow her sister's example and leave school at the age of 11.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Timmy's new business ends up threatening taxi services in the Colorado town, sparking a Wacky Races-type contest between competing transportation choices.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The boys film Craig's mother undressing and upload it to the internet. But as the clip becomes a viral sensation, they feel guilty.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Randy rallies his troops and King Cartman prepares for battle with Princess Kenny as the zombie masses gather outside the mall on Black Friday.(n)

programme.title: Sex Pod
programme.desc: Entertaining sex education series. Angel loves women but fancies men and wonders whether bisexuality is normal. Jelaini wonders why guys are happy to receive oral sex but not give it. (S1, ep9).(n)

programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.desc: Documentary charting in detail the events leading up to the killing of Stacey Mackie in January 2012. Stacey ended her friendship with Terrence Armer, who became abusive and threatening, culminating in his gaining entry to her flat, dousing her in white spirit and setting her alight. The programme features interviews with Stacey's mother and sister and a detective inspector from Cumbria police force, as well as expert analysis from a criminal psychologist.(n)

programme.title: Inside the World's Toughest Prisons
programme.sub-title: Inside the World's Toughest Prisons: Mexico.
programme.desc: Paul Connolly is in Mexico, where he enters El Hongo maximum-security prison, a concrete fortress of discipline and punishment from which no one has ever escaped. It was designed to hold more than a thousand inmates, and during Paul's stay he spends one of the most nervous nights of his life banged up in a cell with 37 convicts, including drug traffickers and kidnappers. He is also given rare access to Echo Block - a forbidding top-security jail-within-a-jail designed to contain drug cartel bosses and hit-men.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Toddlers Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Compilation of internet videos featuring children doing bizarre and humorous things. Youngsters featured include sassy six-year-old Johanna, whose extraordinary performance of Aretha Franklin's Respect at her school recital in 2015 has been viewed more than 50 million times. Plus, three-year-old April, who blames a nail-polish disaster on her doll. Featuring contributions by Zoe Lyons, Hal Cruttenden and Ellie Taylor. Narrated by Iain Lee.(n)

programme.title: Elysium
programme.desc: In the future, most of the human race exists in poverty on a ruined Earth, while a wealthy elite live in luxury on an orbiting space station. A man dying of radiation poisoning fights security forces to gain access to the satellite and its medical facilities. Sci-fi thriller from the director of District 9, starring Matt Damon, Jodie Foster and Sharlto Copley.(n)

programme.title: Jumper
programme.desc: A man discovers he has the ability to teleport, a talent he cleverly exploits to rob banks undetected while living a life of luxury all over the world. However, he soon learns he is not the only one with this power - and that a secret society of religious fanatics is determined to wipe out him and all of his kind. Fantasy thriller, with Hayden Christensen, Jamie Bell and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A disgraced basketball coach takes a job at a small Indiana high-school and leads the small squad on an improbable run for a state chamionship. Meanwhile, he helps the town drunk, a former basketball player, redeeem himself(n)

programme.title: Mercury Rising
programme.desc: A renegade FBI agent (Bruce Willis) races against time and the government when a 9-year-old autistic boy cracks a national-security code. Directed by Harold Becker and based on the novel "Simple Simon" by Ryne Douglas Pearson. Alec Baldwin, Miko Hughes, Chi McBride, Kim Dickens(n)

programme.title: Starring Adam West
programme.desc: Actor Adam West is profiled(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother
programme.desc: Everyone knows it takes an Undercover Brother to foil The Man. This time, The Man has launched Operation Whitewash, a plot to undermine an African-American general's presidential ambitions. But with the Undercover Brother (Eddie Griffin) on the case, alongside his sexy sidekick, Sistah Girl (Aunjanue Ellis), the general is sure to see the inside of the Oval Office. The 70's fashion-fabulous duo dons the latest in country club attire to infiltrate The Man's plan and root out his evil accomplice the White She Devil (Denise Richards)(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: This comedy from The Full Monty director Peter Cattaneo stars Rainn Wilson as a man whose life has well and truly fallen apart. Twenty years previously, Robert "Fish" Fishman was heavy rock band Vesuvius's drummer. But, when Vesuvius were offered a support slot for Whitesnake on the condition that they ditch their drummer, Fish soon found himself packing his sticks. Now, two decades on, he's been sacked from his dead-end job, ditched by his girlfriend and forced to move into his sister's attic. However, he unexpectedly - and unwittingly - gets another bite at stardom while preparing for a one-off gig with his 18-year-old nephew Josh's band. The only place Fish can find to rehearse in is very stuffy and humid, so - because he's on his own - he chooses to play naked. But he doesn't realise he's being recorded. And when the film clip is posted on the web it goes viral..(n)

programme.title: A Serious Man
programme.desc: Meek physics professor Larry Gopnic finds his life unravelling as he deals with his cheating wife, his layabout brother, his disobedient children, threats to his tenure and a next-door neighbour who likes to sunbathe in the nude(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: A young stud who is going nowhere fast in small-town Texas heads for New York in this classic downbeat drama which took the Oscar for best picture. On the sleazy streets of the Big Apple, Joe Buck's dreams of finding glamour and adventure are shattered by a succession of unsavoury incidents, but he finds a friend in the unlikely shape of 'Ratso' Rizzo, a street hustler with a wasting lung disease(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: Conservative Welton Academy is enlivened by the arrival of a charismatic English teacher who inspires his students with unconventional methods and philosophies(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two longtime friends take stock of their accomplished artistic careers in this meditative drama written and directed by Paolo Sorrentino. Michael Caine stars as Fred Ballinger, a retired composer who, at the behest of his daughter (Rachel Weisz), is on vacation in the Alps with his friend Mick Boyle (Harvey Keitel), a filmmaker currently working on a new project. Fred believes he is enjoying his retirement, but he is soon approached with an offer of a British knighthood if he'll conduct a performance of a famous piece he wrote(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: A young couple staying at a remote holiday spot are terrorized by masked intruders(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this Western thriller(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a group of extreme athletes who are using their specialized skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. This high-octane action thriller is a remake of the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: Val Kilmer, who dazzled as Jim Morrison in "The Doors" and Doc Holliday in "Tombstone," adds another outstanding real-life characterization to his résumé---John Holmes. This film chronicles the porn star's suspected involvement in a 1981 homicide that left four of his 'friends' dead. The first-rate supporting cast includes Lisa Kudrow, Eric Bogosian, Dylan McDermott and Ted Levine(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: Matt Damon and Heath Ledger play two con artist brothers who take advantage of local superstitions. Girls have been disappearing from a forest, and this time it may be real. Dir: Terry Gilliam(n)

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Directors Bobby and Peter Farrelly making a film about conjoined twins sounds like a recipe for stomach-churning grossness, but Stuck on You gets its laughs from others, not the twins. Bo and Walt run a diner in Martha's Vineyard, but Walt yearns for Hollywood stardom. Bo agrees to humour him and they hit LA, where Walt lands a part in a TV series starring Cher (herself): the shy Bo has to be hidden by scenery or "brushed out" from the scene. But Bo harbours a love for LA-based May (Wen Yann Shih), their romance previously conducted on-line, while Walt falls for April (Eva Mendes), an understanding pool babe. Can the disparate pair find love, success and happiness? With cameos from Jack Nicholson and Meryl Streep(n)

programme.title: Sweet November
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves and Charlize Theron shine in this romance about a workaholic who falls for an eccentric woman. Sara (Theron) convinces Nelson (Reeves) that his fast-paced life is unsatisfying and invites him to live with her for a month so she can enlighten him. Greg Germann, Liam Aiken, Lauren Graham(n)

programme.title: Sweet Dreams
programme.desc: Jessica Lange portrays country-western singer Patsy Cline (1932-63). Ed Harris. Hilda: Ann Wedgeworth. Randy: David Clennon. Gerald: James Staley. Woodhouse: Gary Basaraba. Otis: John Goodman. Wanda: P.J. Soles. Girl Singer: Terri Gardner. Karel Reisz directed(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Joe Darrow works as a doctor in the emergency room of Chicago Memorial Hospital. His wife, Emily Darrow, was last seen in a rainstorm in Venezuela, where she was on a retreat with the Red Cross offering humanitarian aid. She vanished in a bus accident. There were no survivors and her body was never found. That rich, green, exotic land is left behind as Joe is challenged to persevere through sad, rainy days back home. Joe promised Emily that if anything ever happened to her, he would visit her patients in the oncology ward. Strangely, the children seem to know him, and they say they've seen Emily in their near-death experiences. Joe starts to believe that his wife is using the near-death experiences of her terminal patients to communicate with him, through images the children report seeing in their dreams, and symbols they are inexplicably compelled to draw. While the children see Joe as a kindred spirit, the hospital staff worries about how these interactions are agitating them. At home, Joe begins finding other ethereal evidence of his wife's attempt to contact him from beyond the grave, some of it featuring the image of a dragonfly, which was the shape of the birthmark on her shoulder. His friends and a caring neighbor (Kathy Bates) worry that Joe is losing his marbles, especially as his quest becomes more frantic, putting his job in jeopardy(n)

programme.title: Freeheld
programme.desc: Docudrama about terminally ill New Jersey police officer Laurel Hester, whose 2005 legal battle for the right to pass her pension benefits on to her female life partner became an equal-rights milestone(n)

programme.title: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.
programme.desc: In this slick, entertaining spy thriller set in the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin team up to stop an international criminal organization that is trafficking nuclear weapons and technology. Adaptation of the TV series of the same name(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: A woman on the lam with her young daughter takes drastic steps when her abusive husband tracks them down(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biopic spanning a twenty-year period in the life of eccentric millionaire Howard Hughes, including the films, the women and his pioneering success as a world-class aviator. Visually stunning drama(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Writer-director Paul WS Anderson tunes-up Roger Corman's 1975 cult vehicle "Death Race 2000" in this action flick about a contest pitting a convict against other convicts, with the winner walking off with his freedom(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Action thriller sequel. Former LA cop Brian O'Conner is making his living as a street racer in Miami when he is recruited by an FBI agent to help catch a local drug baron(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant (Frank Grillo) who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate (Elizabeth Mitchell) who wants to end "the Purge." Written and directed by James DeMonaco(n)

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Castle looks into a mysterious death of a fan at a sci-fi convention, apparently killed by a genuine space laser, of which only two working examples exist. Away from the investigation, the event sees Beckett's love of the cult series Nebula 9 revealed. Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.sub-title: Sunday in the Park with Jorge.
programme.desc: A woman's body is found in a Central Park lake during a Puerto Rican Day parade. The victim turns out to be the wife of a powerful billionaire, and pressure is put on the police to find the culprit quickly. Suspicion falls on the business partner of the victim's husband and a witness comes forward to identify him, making everything seem clear cut - but not for long.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A restaurant owner is beaten to death and Briscoe and Green's investigation leads them to a gang of thrill-seeking teenagers who tried to steal from the victim but ended up killing him. The ensuing case leaves McCoy with a dilemma over whether the accused are old enough to face the death penalty.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Hawkes is accused of killing someone in a bar-room brawl, and seemingly irrefutable evidence is produced against him. Mac and the team are taken off the case, but refuse to accept he is guilty and ponder whether anyone has a motive to frame him. Meanwhile, Stella and Danny answer a call reporting a body found in a peep-show booth. Gary Sinister and Hill Harper star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when a reporter is murdered as she prepares to break a story about a mysterious Libyan freedom fighter named El-Libi. The activist is wanted by the country's government after establishing `radio free Libya' in the aftermath of Gaddafi's closure of the internet. Meanwhile, more details of Callen's past begin to emerge.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Beckett feels she finally has an opportunity to incriminate senator William H Bracken, the politician who had her mother killed, after the charred remains of one of his employees - and possible mistress - is found inside a dustbin. Stana Katic stars.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: A badly-wounded Reese goes on the hunt for Simmons, seeking vengeance for what he did to Carter, leaving Finch desperately trying to locate his friend before he succumbs to his injures. As Finch follows the trail of destruction, he comes across the forger Simmons hired to get a new identity and passport - and soon has a lead to the crooked HR officer's escape plan. Crime drama, starring Jim Caviezel and Michael Emerson.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green are convinced that former career criminal Cally Lonegan has killed his business partner who had been stealing company money. However, their suspect has a cast iron alibi - he is a Mob informant and at the time of the murder was being followed by the FBI. The case takes a more complicated turn when an eyewitness is found dead and the detectives discover Lonegan has a twin brother.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the attempted murder of a tough judge, but when the culprit is found Carmichael and McCoy have a difficult time building a case. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach, Sam Waterston and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Stella fears she may have been infected with HIV-positive blood while conducting inquiries at a murder scene, and Danny investigates the case of a woman whose body has been found in a bath filled with water and rose petals, but has trouble establishing the cause of death. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sam heads to Sudan to help a CIA agent gather evidence of al-Qaeda terrorist training, but Callen is forced to rush to the country too, when one of them is killed while carrying out the mission. Crime drama, starring LL Cool J and Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Deeks places his job in danger when he shoots and kills an unarmed man during a mission to retrieve Semtex explosives from a marine warehouse, prompting unexpected emotions for Kensi as she contemplates losing her partner. Crime drama, starring Eric Christian Olsen and Daniela Ruah.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: FBI agent Dana Lewis suspects that a 25-year-old rape-murder case in New York is connected to several unsolved crimes across the country and joins the SVU to investigate. Lewis relentlessly pursues her prime suspect, but Benson and Amaro have their doubts about his guilt. Hard-hitting and emotional series chronicling the life and crimes of the New York Police Department, starring Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman is arrested after the attempted kidnapping a six-year-old girl, and tells officers the child is her daughter. DNA evidence appears to support her claim, and the ensuing investigation uncovers a fertility doctor's unethical practices, prompting a custody battle between the child's biological parent and the woman who gave birth to her. Christopher Meloni stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler investigate the disappearance of a Chinese woman and her daughter, and uncover a conspiracy involving women smuggled into the country by gangsters running a prostitution ring. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Wheeler and her new partner Zach Nichols (Jeff Goldblum joining the cast) investigate when an aspiring MC is killed and one of his fellow musicians is found dead at the bottom of a lift shaft just before he was due to play an important gig. The detectives discover the second victim's replacement is extremely ambitious, but also that the manager of the building where the murdered men lived also manages other artists and may have been jealous of their success.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Natalia is arrested for the murder of her abusive ex-husband Nick Townsend, but the team is sidelined from the investigation by Internal Affairs, leaving it up to Horatio and Calleigh to prove her innocence. In a separate investigation, a wealthy single man is found dead in his mansion - and subsequent developments reveal the two cases are related.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Frank steps on a land mine and realises he cannot remove his foot without triggering the device, leaving Horatio and the bomb disposal team facing the delicate task of deactivating it. Meanwhile, Delko breaks up a domestic dispute while off duty - only to become the subject of a lawsuit. Rex Linn and Adam Rodriguez star.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: As Dawson's life hangs in the balance, Voight focuses on bringing in Pulpo by whatever means necessary. The team soon discovers that the drug lord's right-hand man has been killed, and believes the only people Pulpo will turn to are his `second family'. Meanwhile, Jin takes a surreptitious look through Voight's computer and presents copies of a few files to Sgt Stillwell of Internal Affairs, the man who is trying to bring Hank down. Chicago Fire spin-off, starring Jason Beghe, Sophia Bush, Jon Seda, Jesse Lee Soffer and Patrick John Flueger.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A pregnant loan officer is found murdered in the boot of her car and the trail leads to drugs and a professional basketball player, whose ties to the victim appear to extend beyond the financial deal she approved for him. Detective drama, with Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac and the team are called to a deaf family's home, where a woman has been shot and killed - a case that brings up memories of Lindsay's troubled past. Meanwhile, Stella and Danny investigate the murder of a promising figure-skater who has been found dead at the ice rink - and come to suspect she was not the intended target. Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes and Anna Belknap star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team uncovers an alliance between al-Qaeda and a Mexican drug cartel when it investigates a shoot-out at a pawn shop. As the agents explore the reasons behind the unusual coalition, a Mexican police chief with a vendetta against the Mendoza gang joins them.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The duo investigate when the body of a TV reality show star is found in a Manhattan alley. Meanwhile, things do not go according to plan when Castle tries to give Beckett a Valentine's Day gift. Crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: The number of an already dying man comes up, and Reese leaves the team behind in the aftermath of the war with the crime organisation. Meanwhile, flashbacks to Finch's adolescence provide an insight into his creation of The Machine. Jim Caviezel and Michael Emerson star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the death of a woman killed in what appears to be a road rage incident. However, as they retrace her last actions, they suspect she was accidentally murdered by an assassin following the wrong car. The intended victim turns out to be a reporter claiming to have uncovered a plot to rig an election by a senator, who Briscoe suspects of having connections with the Mafia.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The body of a female jogger is found in a park, and detectives Briscoe and Green discover she was mauled to death by a pit-bull terrier. The race is on to trace the animal and its owner before another tragedy occurs - and the team is shocked to discover a warehouse where dogs are trained for illegal fighting. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac and Danny try to catch the killer of a conman whose body has been found lying in a pile of money - a mystery compounded by the discovery that he had been building an ark in his back garden. Across the city, Stella and Flack examine the body of a man dressed in a cigarette costume who appears to have burned to death, and follow a trail that leads to the headquarters of a tobacco company.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen, Kensi and the team hunt for an electromagnetic pulse device that was stolen from a college research facility, and could destroy Los Angeles if activated, killing millions of people. programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Nell goes undercover at the Department of Defence after a researcher is found dead, and new NCIS assistant director Owen Granger fails to endear himself to the rest of the team. Crime drama, starring Renee Felice Smith and Miguel Ferrer.(n)

programme.desc: A professional golfer is murdered, and a search of her phone's GPS and call history reveals she had been contacting someone on an anonymous `burner' phone. The phone's location appears to correlate to big golf tournaments, except for one weekend when calls were made to Vegas when there was no such event taking place. programme.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
programme.desc: Directed by Mike Newell, the fourth installment to the Harry Potter series finds Harry (Daniel Radcliffe) wondering why his legendary scar -- the famous result of a death curse gone wrong -- is aching in pain, and perhaps even causing mysterious visions. Before he can think too much about it, however, Harry boards the train to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he will attend his fourth year of magical education. Shortly after his reunion with his best friends, Ron (Rupert Grint) and Hermione (Emma Watson), Harry is introduced to yet another Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher: the grizzled Mad-Eye Moody (Brendan Gleeson), a former dark wizard catcher who agreed to take on the infamous "DADA" professorship as a personal favor to Headmaster Dumbledore (Michael Gambon). Of course, Harry's wishes for an uneventful school year are almost immediately shattered when he is unexpectedly chosen, along with fellow student Cedric Diggory (Robert Pattinson), as Hogwarts' representative in the Tri-Wizard Tournament, which awards whoever completes three magical tasks the most skillfully with a thousand-galleon purse and the admiration of the international wizard community. As difficult as it is to deal with his schoolwork, friendships, and the tournament at the same time (not to mention his feelings toward the ever unfathomable Professor Snape (Alan Rickman), Harry doesn't realize that the most feared wizard in the world, Lord Voldemort, is anticipating the tournament, as well(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate

Lena Olin, Emmanuelle Seigner, Barbara Jefford, Jack Taylor(n)

programme.title: Ricochet
programme.desc: A cop receives lots of media attention when he nabs an infamous, sadistic killer at an amusement park. The murderer stews in jail for seven years, obsessively following the rising career of his arresting officer, who becomes a DA with a promising future, a husband, and a dad. This doesn't sit well with the vengeful convict, who after escaping from prison, puts into play a series of fiendish plots..(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: When hippie-esque psycho Scorpio goes on a killing spree, Inspector Harry Callahan and new partner Chico are assigned to hunt him down, but not before the Mayor and Lt. Bressler admonish Callahan about his heavy-handed tactics(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: In this drama, two U.S. Marines who stood side by side on the field of battle are reunited in a court of law. Attorney Hayes Hodges (Tommy Lee Jones) once aspired to a career as an officer, but a serious injury in Vietnam put an end to his military future, leaving him bitter and resentful. Col. Terry L. Childers (Samuel L. Jackson) fought alongside Hodges and once saved his life; when Childers is threatened with a court martial for ordering his troops to fire on civilians during a raid on an American embassy, Hodges is the only lawyer that he can trust, and the case gives Hodges a chance for revenge against the military system that he feels has wronged him. Rules of Engagement also features Kim Delaney, Ben Kingsley, Blair Underwood, and Anne Archer(n)

programme.title: Heartbreak Ridge

programme.title: The 33

programme.title: Black Mass

With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: Stateside

programme.title: Breakfast

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Hospital Bed
programme.desc: A 64-year-old grandfather is rushed into Barnsley Hospital's A&E with a severe pain in his abdomen, and a local teenage footballer is brought in with a dislocated elbow.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: The team unravels some of the costs involved in eating out, and ask whether restaurants charge a fair price for wine. Plus, the ins and outs of tipping.(n)

programme.desc: An amateur race driver loses control on the track and his car somersaults towards the crash barriers, his safety cage fails and he is left hanging upside down from the vehicle. Plus, a young mother contacts emergency services suspecting her baby has meningitis.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Kate Bliss help two sets of friends searching for items at the Lincolnshire Antiques and Home Show. Charlie Ross presents and tries his hand as a wartime firefighter.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Valerie investigates a patient's suspicions that her husband is cheating on her, but the truth is far stranger. Rob is weighed down by guilt, and Ruhma and Heston make secret plans.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.title: Yes Chef

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Kate Bliss v John Cameron UK Antiques Fair.
programme.desc: Kate Bliss and John Cameron search for bargains at an antiques fair in Berkshire. Kate struggles to make her first purchase, while John hunts for weird and wacky goods, before they attempt to sell the items they've bought for a profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Gabby Logan present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As Steven helps Abi plan her 21st birthday party, she realises all might not be well between him and Lauren. Dot steps in to help Honey assure Will he has nothing to worry about in his new flat, and one resident is faced with a heartbreaking situation.(n)

programme.title: Kat and Alfie: Redwater
programme.desc: With Agnes pushing for the Moons to leave town, Alfie agrees that Tommy needs to get back to school - while secretly worrying about his own health. Has the time finally come to share his concerns with Kat? Eileen reveals her plans to transform the family farm into a cookery school, and while Roisin is appalled at the idea, Agnes is delighted her daughter has found a reason to stay. When Kieran is forced to face his fear of water, past memories come flooding back. Shane Richie, Jessie Wallace, Angeline Ball, Maria Doyle Kennedy and Fionnula Flanagan star.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: The Isle of Sheppey.
programme.desc: New series. Nick Knowles travels to the Isle of Sheppey in Kent to meet two extraordinary dads, Garry and Kyle, who have adopted four vulnerable children - three of whom have special needs - to give them the best life possible. But their cramped three-bedroom bungalow is making family life difficult. So to give this family the space they so desperately need, the DIY SOS builders are undertaking their most ambitious project yet - to demolish the bungalow and build a bespoke five-bedroom house in its place. But with just nine days to complete the task, it looks like being their toughest one yet.(n)

programme.title: Election 2017
programme.desc: David Dimbleby takes the helm for the BBC's comprehensive overnight coverage as the results of the snap General Election are announced. Over the next 24 hours the people of Britain will discover who will lead them over the next five years. BBC correspondents led by Andrew Marr, Nick Robinson, Kirsty Wark and Sophie Raworth will be at the key counts, while Jeremy Vine, Emily Maitlis and Professor John Curtice analyse the results as they come in. Mishal Husain interviews key political players, media editor Amol Rajan follows how the night is unfolding on social media and political editor Laura Kuenssberg assesses the impact this result will have in the days, weeks and years ahead.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha gets a shock visitor, while Emma and Zara try to be helpful but make things worse. Elsewhere, Ruhma and Heston wonder if they are a making a big song-and-dance over nothing.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts a game show in which players compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef

programme.desc: Kate Bliss takes on John Cameron in the final challenge - the showdown. They must each make purchases at all of their four regular buying locations and sell at least half at auction. One expert will be crowned champion once all the deals are done. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Amol Rajan, the BBC's media editor, host the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Wales rugby union star Scott Quinnell, ex-Everton midfielder Leon Osman, former British number one tennis player Annabel Croft and Ryder Cup-winning golfer Nicolas Colsaerts join regular team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson and host Sue Barker.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey and Martin excitedly attend their baby scan, although when Stacey later admits to her husband she is worried how people will react to her being pregnant again, Martin agrees to keep the news quiet. Abi does her best to support Lauren - but things soon become tricky - Jane and Kathy clash over Ian's new lifestyle, and Louise does her best to avoid Travis.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: In the immediate wake of the General Election, David Dimbleby chairs a special edition of the topical debate from London as guests from the worlds of politics and the media answer questions posed by members of the public.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got Election News for You.
programme.desc: Comedian Jo Brand assumes the mantle as host, inviting former Labour MP Alan Johnson and comedian Ross Noble to join regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton on the satirical current affairs quiz.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham chats to WBA, IBF and IBO heavyweight boxing champion Anthony Joshua, who recently secured his status thanks to his 11th round knockdown of Ukrainian opponent Wladimir Klitschko. Oscar-winning actress Rachel Weisz discusses her new film My Cousin Rachel, while Shawn Mendes performs There's Nothing Holdin' Me Back, and actor Martin Freeman and comedian Greg Davies are also on the sofa.(n)

programme.title: The Proposal
programme.desc: A Canadian publishing editor working in New York faces deportation to her own country. Desperate to stay in America, she offers her assistant a promotion if he will marry her, but an immigration official becomes suspicious and the pair are forced to go to desperate lengths to look like a happy couple. Romantic comedy, starring Sandra Bullock and Ryan Reynolds.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A British policeman leads an armed raid on the home of a man feared to have a gun, and a UK flying doctor fights to save a farmer's wife who is badly injured.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: The team explore the truth behind supermarket deals and offers, and also report on the so called 'healthy' snacks sold as an alternative to sweets at supermarket tills.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Culinary challenge hosted by Sheree Murphy in which michelin starred chef Rupert Rowley puts three home cooks through a series of challenges, including how to make a crepe suzette.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: The four remaining teams of professional pastry chefs create 36 identical petite charlottes and 36 shaped macarons in two hours. For their final challenge the teams must put an innovative spin on the classic towering French celebration cake, the croquembouche, all of which will be judged by Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin. Angus Deayton hosts.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: Wendy Brightwell is reunited with her half-brother Rod and introduces him to her children for the first time. Cameras also follow Margaret Teague's emotional family journey when she meets Mark, the brother who didn't know she existed.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Paudge's suspicious superiors swoop against `Beady' Burke's gang, gambling on gaining leverage over him, while David tempts Katie to a new home.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore how Britain's love of cheese has evolved over centuries, travelling to Scotland to sample some of its finest varieties and discovering that the original cheesecake recipes were not American but British.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: Jonathan Scott is in Tsavo, where one of the older orphans is diagnosed with a possible heart condition, while Michaela Strachan follows the separation of two elephants when Makena joins the older animals at the Ithumba release site.(n)

programme.title: Highlands: Scotland's Wild Heart
programme.desc: Following the efforts being made by scientists, conservationists and local people in the Highlands as they work to repair the damage of the past and rebuild wild landscapes and habitats. The programme meets Dave Anderson from Forestry Commission Scotland and his colleague Simon Smith as they tag and monitor red kite and osprey chicks, gaining a unique perspective of the lives of the birds before they fly the nest. Cameras also capture the efforts of the Scottish Wildcat Action Plan team, as well as Paul Lister's project to reintroduce wolves and bears to his Alladale Wilderness Reserve. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts James Braxton and Helen Hall begin their journey in Wallingford, Oxfordshire, before travelling to Weybridge in Surrey. Later, they try to sell their purchases for a profit at an auction in Wokingham, Berkshire.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch Unsprung
programme.desc: Olympic champion rower Helen Glover talks about wildlife in the water, there is a peak behind the scenes, and Chris Packham and Lindsey Chapman take viewers' questions and comments.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo continues his travels through Switzerland from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. Along the way, he is caught up in a war zone with the Red Cross, tries his hand at watchmaking, and takes to the skies in a vintage bi-plane to retrace the epic journey of the pioneering pilot who was first to fly over the Alps.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Phil Carmichael, Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie continue the battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's Wales final.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan report live on the latest from the National Trust's Sherborne Estate in the heart of the Cotswolds. Martin Hughes-Games and Iolo Williams pit two birds against each other in a challenge to see which is the ultimate hunter, and Gillian Burke reports on some fascinating new science.(n)

programme.title: Paula
programme.desc: Mac recovers from the attack, but faces repercussions at work. He continues to delve into James's past, discovering stories of a troubled childhood. Meanwhile, as if things couldn't get any worse for Paula, she faces the possibility that Callum may never recover and is haunted by the danger James poses. So she resolves to confront him one last time - but this time she is prepared for a fight. Denise Gough, Tom Hughes and Owen McDonnell star in the conclusion of the thriller, by Olivier and Tony-award winning writer Conor McPherson. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain returns with a timely new run of the topical comedy show, with Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, James Acaster, Milton Jones and Tez Ilyas joining regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at what's been happening in the news through stand-up and improvised games.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order
programme.desc: New series. The comedian tries to make sense of the modern world, using a combination of stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction to dissect the week's news - with a panel of guests on hand to take Frankie to task over his claims. Guests on the first show include fellow comic Sara Pascoe.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties during the election, filmed on the afternoon of transmission. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: India v Sri Lanka. Action from the latest match of the tournament, which saw the Group B teams face each other at The Oval.(n)

programme.title: Sgt Pepper's Musical Revolution - with Howard Goodall
programme.desc: The composer explores why the Beatles' 50-year-old album is still revered as an innovative, revolutionary and influential release. With the help of out-takes, studio conversations between the band and never-heard-before outside of Abbey Road, Howard gets `under the bonnet' of the album, taking the music apart and reassembling it to reveal how it works. Producer George Martin and his team constructed the album sound by sound, layer by layer - a formula that became the norm for just about every rock act who followed.(n)

programme.title: Dara and Ed's Road to Mandalay
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Ed Byrne continue their journey in Thailand, where they find out about locals' reaction to the tourist explosion in Bangkok, explore the ruins of the capital of Ayutthaya and visit an elephant sanctuary. Along the way, they stop off for a massage and Ed has a go at Thai boxing. They also visit a turtle conservation centre, where they help to return two of the animals to the sea, and meet members of a hill tribe who have turned their tradition of downhill racing in wooden carts into a tourist attraction.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: The group enjoy their last few days together on the La Banditaccia farm, before reflecting on what they have learnt about themselves during their stay, and saying their final goodbyes. There's a chance of a lifetime on the horizon for one member of the group, while others reach some surprising conclusions about their future in Italy. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A British nurse races to rescue a critically ill baby in a remote town in the Bush, while a group of UK cops deal with trouble at a funeral in the Outback.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: The team unravels some of the costs involved in eating out, and ask whether restaurants charge a fair price for wine. Plus, the ins and outs of tipping.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Theo Randall puts three amateur cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including how to make linguine asparagus carbonara, choosing one of them to join him in the final.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Mark Lane is in Hackney, finding out how a car wrecker's yard at the side of a Tudor National Trust property has been transformed into an award-winning garden used by the local community. Carol Klein visits Oxford Botanic garden to view their euphorbia collection and Rachel de Thame visits a garden which has opened to the public every year for 90 years as part of the National Gardens Scheme.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Hospital Bed
programme.desc: A 56-year-old woman enters Barnsley Hospital's A&E Department short of breath. At Leeds Children's Hospital, a five-year-old ends his leukaemia treatment. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of properties in Crewe in Cheshire, Chartham Hatch, Kent and Rusholme, Manchester to hear their renovation plans.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Angela Rippon and Gloria Hunniford explore the implications of the recent vegetable shortage, and the effect it continues to have today. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A pit stop in a motorcycle race is engulfed in flames when fuel spills out of a rider's tank, and a holiday maker on safari gets too close to a family of cheetahs. Presented by Alex Jones.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Kingston upon Thames, south west London, two teams of mothers and sons are challenged to pick up bargains at an antiques fair. Antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and Kate Bliss are on hand to guide them towards turning a profit at auction as presenter Tim Wonnacott observes proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Property series in which people get the chance to experience life in Australia or New Zealand before deciding whether they want to make the move permanently.(n)

programme.title: Election 2017
programme.desc: Coverage transfers from BBC One with Andrew Neil reporting from the House of Commons as politicians return to Westminster and BBC political editor Laura Kuenssberg monitoring events in Downing Street. Presented by Huw Edwards, with analysis by Andrew Marr, Emily Maitlis, Jeremy Vine and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch Unsprung
programme.desc: Chris Packham is joined by Floella Benjamin, while Ballerina-turned-Strictly star Darcey Bussell shares her wild side in Hide Share and Lindsey Chapman sets the Unsprung Quiz.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Genoa to the Brenner Pass - Part One.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo discovers how an Edwardian Briton brought football to the Italian port of Genoa. He also finds himself ambushed by singers of the city's legendary trallalero and learns to whip up a mean pesto Genovese. After sampling la dolce vita in Portofino, Michael takes the train as it clings to the cliffs along the Riviera Di Levanti to reach the impossibly picturesque and remote villages of the Cinque Terre, now a national park. A fishing trip in the bay affords spectacular views of the villages from the water.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Wales chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest Dan Bloxham - Wimbledon's Master of Ceremonies responsible for presenting the trophy to the tournament's champions - as the programme continues its tennis-themed series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift, Carol Klein and Adam Frost take an exclusive look at the new RHS Chatsworth Flower Show, meeting designer Jo Thompson as she prepares her show garden with a difference. In the Floral Pavilion, Carol finds pioneering plants that have shaped the gardens of today, while garden designer Arit Anderson looks to the future - meeting the team behind a garden built for the changing climate.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Resolutions are tested as Louis XIV returns to Versailles vowing to purify his private life, while Madame de Montespan hopes to cement her place in his heart. The feelings of Philippe for Chevalier are rocked by an unexpected depth of concern for Princess Palatine, who shows symptoms of possible poisoning. Meanwhile, Fabien Marchal faces a personal appeal to review his refusal to return. George Blagden, Anna Brewster, Alexander Vlahos, Evan Williams, Jessica Clark and Tygh Runyan star in the sumptuous period drama.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Award-winning funnywoman Gina Yashere introduces surreal Australian comedian Sam Simmons and rising comedy star Ellie Taylor to the stage in a gig recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties, following the various arguments and catastrophes that occur as the outcome of the General Election becomes apparent. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Evan Davis, Kirsty Wark and Emily Maitlis report on the outcome of the General Election.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: New Zealand v Bangladesh. Action from the latest match of the tournament, which saw the Group A teams face each other at The SSE SWALEC in Cardiff.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen host the 20th anniversary edition of the music show, first broadcast on January 5, 1984, featuring Frankie Goes to Hollywood, Rod Stewart, Status Quo, Frank Kelly, Slade and the Flying Pickets, as well as archive footage of artists to have appeared over the years.(n)

programme.title: The Wonderful World of Blood - with Michael Mosley
programme.desc: Documentary in which Michael Mosley undergoes six experiments in order to take an in-depth look at blood, including injecting it with snake venom to demonstrate its ability to clot within seconds, and starving it of oxygen to see how it instantly responds. Michael also discovers how it tastes when he tries some black pudding made from his own blood.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Investigating the story of how a Russian internet millionaire, Dmitry Itskov, is turning to cutting-edge science to try to unlock the secret of living for ever. The programme investigates the real science inspiring his bold plan to upload the human mind to a computer, and examines whether his goal of bringing about immortality for humans within thirty years is attainable.(n)

programme.title: Engineering Giants
programme.desc: Tom Wrigglesworth and Rob Bell visit a dry dock in Newcastle, where they witness long-serving North Sea ferry the Pride of Bruges receiving a complete overhaul to extend its working life. The duo explore the inner workings of the 32,000-ton ship, which has transported passengers between Hull and the Belgian port of Zeebrugge for more than a quarter of a century, and travel to a ship-breaking yard to learn how ferries are recycled when they are no longer fit for service.(n)

programme.title: Planet Oil
programme.sub-title: Planet Oil: The Treasure That Conquered the World.
programme.desc: Iain Stewart examines how the fuel has come to dominate the modern world, visiting the places that gave birth to the earth's oil riches, exploring the stories of the people who fought over its control and supply and looking at how mankind's insatiable thirst for oil is changing the planet. In the first episode he looks at how 19th-century amateur geologist George Bissell went searching for oily puddles in Pennsylvania that he had a hunch could be the source of a new kind of fuel, and follows the story on through the development of products that could light homes, and in turn provide power for the newly emerging mass car market.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen host the 20th anniversary edition of the music show, first broadcast on January 5, 1984, featuring Frankie Goes to Hollywood, Rod Stewart, Status Quo, Frank Kelly, Slade and the Flying Pickets, as well as archive footage of artists to have appeared over the years.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.sub-title: Arena: American Epic: Out of the Many the One.
programme.desc: A look at Hawaiian influences on US roots music, including the invention of the steel guitar by Joseph Kekuku, and the development of Cajun music in Louisiana. Plus, the story of one of the genre's unsung heroes, Mississippi John Hurt, who became a star in the 1920s, only to return to life as a share cropper in the Great Depression, before a revival of his music in the 1960s.(n)

programme.title: Southern Rock at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by classic Southern rock acts on shows including The Old Grey Whistle Test, In Concert and Wogan. Featuring Lynyrd Skynyrd, the Charlie Daniels Band, the Ozark Mountain Daredevils, Delaney & Bonnie with Eric Clapton, Dickey Betts, formerly of the Allman Brothers Band, the Marshall Tucker Band, Black Oak Arkansas, Greg Allman with Cher, and Edgar Winter.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Investigating the story of how a Russian internet millionaire, Dmitry Itskov, is turning to cutting-edge science to try to unlock the secret of living for ever. The programme investigates the real science inspiring his bold plan to upload the human mind to a computer, and examines whether his goal of bringing about immortality for humans within thirty years is attainable.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Steve Wright introduce performances by the Icicle Works, Howard Jones, Shakin' Stevens and Bonnie Tyler, Roland Rat, Snowy White, Lionel Richie, Joe Fagin and Paul McCartney.(n)

programme.title: The Good Old Days
programme.desc: Leonard Sachs chairs the old-time music hall programme, inviting Bernard Cribbins, Barry Cryer, Robert Tear, Benjamin Luxon, Penny Lane, Larry Parker, Teddy Peiro & Patricio, and members of the Players' Theatre, London to entertain an audience at the Leeds City Varieties. First aired February 22, 1979.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Classic tracks from the decade, featuring the Who's anthem Won't Get Fooled Again and the Rolling Stones' Brown Sugar.(n)

programme.title: The Summer of Love: How Hippies Changed the World
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary recounting the 1967 coming-together that would change the world. The film traces the roots of the hippies to a 19th-century German sect of wandering naturalists that brought its freethinking ideas to California after the Second World War. There it merged with people expressing an interest in Eastern mystical concepts of human nature expounded by thinkers like Aleister Crowley and Aldous Huxley. Added to the mix was the CIA-developed drug LSD and a wave of student activists and anti-war protestors. The outcome was San Francisco's Summer of Love.(n)

programme.title: Sgt Pepper's Musical Revolution - with Howard Goodall
programme.desc: The composer explores why the Beatles' 50-year-old album is still revered as an innovative, revolutionary and influential release. With the help of out-takes, studio conversations between the band and never-heard-before outside of Abbey Road, Howard gets `under the bonnet' of the album, taking the music apart and reassembling it to reveal how it works. Producer George Martin and his team constructed the album sound by sound, layer by layer - a formula that became the norm for just about every rock act who followed.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Elton John, Willie Nelson, Merle Haggard, Alabama Shakes, Jack White, Nas, Ana Gabriel, Beck, Los Lobos and Steve Martin are among the modern artists who test their skills against the demands of the recording machine that literally made American music. There are no edits, no overdubs, and no retakes, and the disc only allows for three minutes of recording time. Despite these limitations, today's recordings for American Epic have one advantage - the freshly recorded sound is crystal clear and of an astonishing depth, transporting listeners vividly into the past - and the future. Narrated by Robert Redford. Last in the series.(n)
