programme.desc: Real-time business and stock-market news broadcast from the New York Stock Exchange begins at the opening bell, and also features reports from the CME Group in Chicago as well as coverage of the closing bells in Europe(n)

programme.title: Squawk Alley
programme.desc: A news program focusing on the intersection of Wall Street and technology, with stories of innovation and disruption along with capital markets and the global economy(n)

programme.title: Fast Money Halftime Report
programme.desc: A fast-paced and dynamic programme that provides actionable market insights to brokers, traders and personal investors, with advice from an expert panel of financial insiders(n)

programme.title: Power Lunch
programme.desc: Real-time coverage of stock-market trends at the middle of the trading day, focusing on influential companies, executives and the worlds of entertainment, real estate, technology, media and fashion. Also: reports from the New York Stock Exchange and the network's global bureaus(n)

programme.title: Closing Bell
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Fast Money
programme.desc: The Fast Money traders give you the information normally reserved for the Wall Street trading floor, enabling you to make decisions that can make you money(n)

programme.title: Options Action
programme.desc: Prominent options traders take part in a roundtable discussion aimed at explaining how to profit via options(n)

programme.title: Mad Money
programme.desc: Colorful financial analyst Jim Cramer offers his insights into the market(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 416. Three brothers pitch their idea for eyewear made from sustainable wood; a duck hunter seeks financial backing for his camouflage clothing; sorority sisters present their collection of premium denim; and a Georgia duo hope to drum up interest in high-end bedding for little girls. Also: an update on a fragrance from Season 3(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 503. Kevin and Robert team up against Mark; and two gorgeous women attempt to charm their way into an investment. Also: a line of aromatherapy sprays designed to help children with their fears; a lightweight carrier for tired tots; a special cooking tray for ramen noodles; and an update on Echo Valley Meats, which failed to attract a Shark in Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 616. A man from Davenport, Fla., seeks an investment in his grass delivery service for pet owners. Also: a device to eliminate clogged sinks; a worry-free way to share lip balm without sharing germs; a climate-control system for beds; and an update on Barbara Corcoran's investment in Tom+Chee from Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 609. The Sharks hear a pitch for hypergravity-exercise clothing, as well as a line of products that appeal to fans of facial hair, and a karaoke machine that adds jaw-dropping vocal harmonies to help users sound like their favorite singing stars. Also: belts that are easy for kids to use; and a follow-up on Barbara's Season 5 investment in a company specializing in hand-knitted socks and leg warmers(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: A Wolf in Priest's Clothing. A profile of Martin Sigillito, a St. Louis Anglican bishop who was convicted of masterminding a Ponzi scheme(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: Brooklyn's Madoff; Corrupted Software. The case of Brooklyn investment manager Philip Barry, who ran a decades-long Ponzi scheme that duped 800 investors. Also: the case of Kevin Carney, who claimed to have created a stock-trading computer program that guaranteed 20-percent returns on investments(n)

He reveals how one king's obsession with money led to the Tower becoming the focus of the worst Jewish massacre the country had ever seen and explains how a mob of disgruntled peasants managed to break through its defences as they sought bloody revenge for taxes they could no longer put up with.(n)

Meanwhile, Oliver and Shane struggle to navigate their new romance, and Norman and Rita encounter a rough patch in their relationship. Drama, starring Eric Mabius, Kristin Booth and Crystal Lowe.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie decides to e-mail Sonya, Sheila is curious how Gary can afford the gift he has given to Terese, while David struggles in his relationship with Tom.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Zac and Leah have a lunch date, Morag manages to get John's appeal fast-tracked and Justin tells Phoebe whether or not he is going to go to America with her.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Craig Charles appraises the best gadgets for this summer's music festivals, with highlights including a new type of tepee that accommodates nine people and takes just three minutes to erect, a camping stove that generates electricity while cooking dinner, a camera that combines the retro style of instant prints with modern photo editing, and a Mini Countryman car with a brand new type of roof-mounted tent. Plus, Georgie Barrat meets sailor Ben Ainslie in Bermuda, where he is planning to triumph in the America's Cup boat race having created one of the most technologically advanced boats ever.(n)

programme.title: Biggest Dog in the World
programme.desc: Documentary meeting three households with Great Danes that definitely live up to their names. Essex woman Claire, whose canine companion is so huge, potential boyfriends do a runner once they see him, a US family who had to super-size their lives to accommodate Rocko, and Welshwoman Julie, who paid a high price for her 20-year canine obsession when her marriage ended. The film also reveals the pros and cons of owning giant dogs, including the crippling costs of more than £12,000 a year, constant care for a pet that cannot be left for longer than four hours at a time and extreme domestic destruction.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: The housemates gather on the sofas as Emma Willis hosts the first eviction of the series, revealing who the public have voted out, then chatting to them about their five days on the show. But before that, there's the question of seeing how they've all been getting on for the past 24 hours in the regular round-up of yesterday's action, as well as a potted round-up of the week's events.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal discusses tonight's eviction, asking the panel whether the public made the right decision, talking to Emma Willis and meeting the unlucky ex-contestant.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.sub-title: Big Brother: Live from the House.
programme.desc: Live streaming action, picking up with the hopefuls to reveal how they are getting on since saying goodbye to another housemate in tonight's eviction.(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this Western thriller(n)

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: A ragtag group of juvenile delinquents assigned the task of cleaning up an abandoned hotel find out just how deadly community service can be when they are stalked by a monstrous, four-hundred-pound maniac with a grudge in director Gregory Dark's wrestling-infused survival horror flick. It was a mere four years ago that seven-foot menace Jacob Goodnight (WWE superstar Kane) was shot in the head and left for dead by a local police officer. But Jacob wasn't going down that easy. With a steel plate subsequently attached to his skull and ten razor-sharp fingernails ready to scrape grey matter from the skulls of his victims, Jacob retreated to the abandoned Blackwell Hotel, where he resided in the darkened, rotting hallways while planning his ultimate revenge. As fate would have it, Jacob wouldn't have to go far to satiate his raging bloodlust, though, and as the unsuspecting teens make their way through the crumbling corridors of the once-luxurious inn guided by the very same policeman who fired that misguided bullet years earlier, the notorious killer sharpens his nails, stalks his prey, and prepares for a little payback(n)

programme.title: La pantalla desnuda
programme.desc: The lives of a woman and her boyfriend are irrevocably altered when a sex tape of them is released online by an infatuated mutual friend(n)

programme.title: Sunshine State
programme.desc: Edie Falco and Angela Basset head the outstanding ensemble cast in this keenly drawn character study. Set in a northern Florida coastal town, it's the tale of an engaging collection of locals and their reactions to the arrival of real-estate developers who want a piece of their paradise.Timothy Hutton, Bill Cobbs. Written and directed by John Sayles(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: Horror tale in which a group of teenagers who believe they have cheated death find themselves at the mercy of an unknown force that seems intent on killing them off one by one. When one of the group's violent prophecy is fulfilled in the form of a plane crash, he and the others who left the flight are subjected to paranormal horror(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Tom Witzky is a regular guy whose life is turned upside down after he is hypnotised by his sister-in-law. The hypnosis unlocks a latent power that allows Tom to see glimpses of supernatural forces. Suddenly, his ordinary life is invaded with violent flashes of horrific images he cannot explain(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: Agnes is running away from her ex boyfriend with her new boyfriend Peter. Peter is also on the run from the military - and bugs that he believes is going to take over his body. Together they seek shelter at a small motel. Soon Agnes also sees the bugs' crawling up from every corner witch is the start for a joint battle against the bugs. Slowly paranoia and fear takes over and threatens to destroy them both mentally and physically(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: In this thrilling fourth installment of the "Jurassic Park" franchise, two young brothers visit an aunt who's an executive at Jurassic World, a theme park populated with genetically resurrected dinosaurs. But chaos erupts when a newly created dino escapes its enclosure, forcing the park's animal behaviorist to save the day(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: A cop, out to avenge the murder of his family, sees the investigation take a supernatural turn for the worse(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Blinded by toxic waste as a child, Matt Murdock develops superhuman awareness and balance which enable him to tackle New York's worst villains(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: A cop in a hi-tech "pre-crime" unit in 2054 goes on the run after being labelled as a future killer. In order to prove his innocence, he kidnaps one of the psychics who predicts the imminent crimes while eluding a determined government agent(n)

programme.title: The Abandoned
programme.desc: An adopted girl returns to her homeland of Russia to explore the dilapidated mountain farm she has recently inherited, only to discover that it harbors a deadly secret in the feature debut from Aftermath director Nacho Cerdà. Shortly after the mysterious death of her birth mother, young Marie was adopted and brought to live in the United States. When Marie receives word that she has inherited an isolated farm in her native Russia, she soon sets out to explore the vast estate and peel away the thick gauze obscuring her secret-shrouded past. Confounded by the local's refusal to show her to the "damned" locale and determined not to give up after coming this far, Marie convinces a man to take her there only to discover that he has inexplicably vanished shortly after arrival. As Marie sets out to explore the ominous and expansive property alone, a surprise encounter with a man named Boris, who claims to have been lured to the house under similar circumstances, sets into motion a chilling series of events in which the ghosts of the past -- as well as deceased doppelgangers of both Marie and Boris -- prevent the frightened pair from leaving. In the terrifying hours that follow, both of these tormented lost souls will find that sometimes the past is best left forgotten(n)

programme.title: Magnum Force
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood makes a second outing in the role that established him as one of Hollywood's top stars. 'Dirty' Harry Callaghan is assigned to look into a series of murders of the city's unpunished criminals(n)

programme.title: K-PAX
programme.desc: (2001) a man (Kevin Spacey) found wandering at New York Central Station is taken into psychiatric care because he claims to be Prot from the planet K-PAX, "1000 of your light years away". Psychiatrist Dr. Mark Powell (Jeff Bridges) doesn't believe him and tries to unlock the trauma, but as Prot reveals knowledge that only a handful of astronomers could know and shows an uncanny knack for helping his fellow patients heal, even Powell begins to wonder. Then, clues that Prot lets slip under hypnosis lead Powell to a more earthly explanation, or so he thinks, in Iain Softley's assured, gripping sci-fi fantasy(n)

programme.title: Cry-Baby
programme.desc: It's the 1950s gang scene where face is everything and mixing with the uncool is frowned upon. When Allison from the Squares falls for Cry-Baby Walker of the Drapes all social barriers fall away as they fight the system to be together(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: Sci-fi thriller. Returning from a routine mission to repair a satellite, astronaut Spencer Armacost briefly loses radio contact with mission control. Spencer lands safely back on Earth, but as time passes his wife's anxiety grows - her husband seems somehow different since his return. And what are the implications for the twins she is now carrying?(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Johnny Depp stars in Roman Polanski's eerie thriller about a rare-book buyer who dabbles in the supernatural when he is asked by a millionaire (Frank Langella) to find a rare volume that enables the reader to contact the Devil. Lena Olin, Emmanuelle Seigner, Barbara Jefford, Jack Taylor(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: Bikini: Una historia real
programme.desc: In 1950s Spain, a small-town mayor wants to convince everyone to allow women to wear bikinis on the beach(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: Philip Seymour Hoffman won a much-deserved Best Actor Oscar for his uncannily astounding performance as "In Cold Blood" author Truman Capote. The exceptional biopic spans the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece. Catherine Keener received a Best Supporting Oscar nod as Capote's friend and researcher Harper Lee, who a few years later would publish "To Kill a Mockingbird." Dan Futterman's script was also Oscar-nominated. Clifton Collins Jr., Chris Cooper, Bob Balaban, Amy Ryan(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: Biopic of entrepreneur Joy Mangano, a divorced mother of two who risks her life's savings to produce and market her invention, the Miracle Mop. The success of that product leads to a home-shopping empire and her ascension to matriarch of her family(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between rookie cop Ben Barber (Kevin Hart) and his seasoned partner (and future brother-in-law) James Payton (Ice Cube) in this sequel to the hit action comedy Ride Along. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a local drug lord with the help of a savvy detective (Olivia Munn). Directed by Tim Story(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Three men relive their carefree college years by killing off as many brain cells as possible in this hilarious comedy. Mitch (Luke Wilson) returns home from a less-than-pleasant business trip one evening to discover his wife, Heidi (Juliette Lewis), involved in a ménage à trois with two blindfolded strangers. Feeling less than welcome at home after this, Mitch rents a house near the campus of a nearby college; two of Mitch's old college buddies, Beanie (Vince Vaughn) and Frank (Will Ferrell). Starring Will Ferrell, Vince Vaughn, Luke Wilson & Juliette Lewis(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: Newlywed Ted wants to become a father, but must prove he's a person in a court of law first(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: In this drama, two U.S. Marines who stood side by side on the field of battle are reunited in a court of law. Attorney Hayes Hodges (Tommy Lee Jones) once aspired to a career as an officer, but a serious injury in Vietnam put an end to his military future, leaving him bitter and resentful. Col. Terry L. Childers (Samuel L. Jackson) fought alongside Hodges and once saved his life; when Childers is threatened with a court martial for ordering his troops to fire on civilians during a raid on an American embassy, Hodges is the only lawyer that he can trust, and the case gives Hodges a chance for revenge against the military system that he feels has wronged him. Rules of Engagement also features Kim Delaney, Ben Kingsley, Blair Underwood, and Anne Archer(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this Western thriller(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Tom's Rhinoplasty. Mr. Garrison takes a leave of absence to have a nose job and is replaced by Miss Ellen, a substitute who threatens Stan and Wendy's relationship. Guest voice: Natasha Henstridge(n)

programme.title: The Daily Show With Trevor Noah
programme.desc: Sebastian Junger and Nick Quested. Filmmakers Sebastian Junger and Nick Quested ("Hell on Earth: The Fall of Syria and the Rise of ISIS")(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Cartman's Mom.... In the Season 1 finale, when Cartman begins to exhibit odd behaviour, a counselor suggests that finding his father may solve his problems(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Cartman's Mom Is Still..... Chef and the boys rush to the hospital to check on Mephesto, who's gunned down just as he's set to reveal the identity of Cartman's father. Meanwhile, the townspeople search for the gunman and battle a snowstorm(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Reverse Cowgirl. When Clive leaves the toilet seat up no one could foresee it would have such dire consequences. The boys' efforts to help him through the aftermath lead to all manners of spookiness(n)

programme.title: Key & Peele
programme.desc: Parole Officer Puppet. Sketches include a parole officer who uses a puppet to connect with a parolee; a man in a neck brace at a party; and a soldier's emotional reunion with his family(n)

programme.title: Key & Peele
programme.desc: Alien Imposters. Sketches in the Season 4 premiere include an alien invasion of Earth; a family reacting to a gay relative's wedding; and surprising views from a couple of racists(n)

programme.title: Key & Peele
programme.desc: Landlord. The first-season finale features a babysitter dealing with a young Forest Whitaker; an apartment rented by a suspicious landlord; President Obama's desire to be treated like an ordinary citizen; and partygoers trying to liven up a bar mitzvah(n)

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid Programming(n)

programme.desc: Paid Programming(n)

programme.title: PiYo Craze!
programme.desc: Define your body with PiYo. Chalene Johnson's new lower-impact workout series combining the muscle-sculpting benefits of Pilates, Yoga and fluid motion all-in-one!(n)

programme.title: Accidents Caught on Camera with HD Mirror Cam!
programme.desc: See crazy accidents caught on camera with the HD Mirror Cam - the most important tool you'll ever own for your car! HD Mirror Cam turns any rearview mirror into a dash cam, and captures it all so if anything ever happens you always have the proof!(n)

programme.title: New! Get Cindy Crawford's anti-aging discovery
programme.desc: Cindy Crawford's Beauty Secrets! Cindy's Targeted Beauty Trio is new for 2017! Rediscover your skin's youthful radiance. This new offer is free to you as part of Meaningful Beauty ULTRA! That's 3 free gifts and free shipping today!(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Sunday, Bloody Sunday. A visit from Red's disagreeable mother has Eric running interference between her and Kitty(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Eric's Buddy. Hyde and Kelso are envious of Buddy. Not only is Buddy rich and popular, but he has a slick set of "wheels"(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Best Christmas Ever. Given 40 dollars by his dad, Red (Kurtwood Smith), to purchase a Christmas tree, Eric (Topher Grace) reasons that he and his pals can spend the money on themselves if they cut down their own tree. Hyde uses his share of the loot to impress Donna (Laura Prepon) with an expensive gift , but it turns out that he may have to take it back to the store. And when Laurie (Lisa Robin Kelly) spikes the Christmas punch, Fez (Wilmer Valderrama) is transformed into a "chick magnet."(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Ski Trip. Jackie breaks up with Kelso after he kisses another, leaving him out of a weekend at her parents' ski cabin. Trucker: Nick Bakay. Kelso: Ashton Kutcher. Hyde: Danny Masterson. Jackie: Mila Kunis(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Stolen Car. Red takes the Vista Cruiser away from Eric after he discovers a small scratch in the paintwork(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: That Wrestling Show. After Red and Bob join the gang at a wrestling match, Red tries to bond with Eric, while Bob frets about Midge's group therapy, wondering where he's gone wrong(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The First Date. Eric (Topher Grace) takes Donna (Laura Prepon) out for their first formal Valentine's Day date at the posh Vineyard restaurant. The occasion is marred by the omnipresence of Hyde (Danny Masterson) and a misdelivered order of a very potent alcoholic beverage. Meanwhile, the Formans (Kurtwood Smith, Debra Jo Rupp) and the Pinciottis (Don Stark, Tanya Roberts) reach an impasse in their friendship(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The Pill. On career day Eric spends time with Kitty at the hospital, Fez and Hyde spend time with Hyde's mom who is the lunch lady, and Kelso can't seem to find out what his dad does as his job(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Philosophy. JD philosophises about death with a patient who is awaiting a heart transplant, Elliot campaigns for Dr Kelso to allow the female staff their own locker room, and a series of freak events hamper Turk's plans to propose to Carla(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Brother, My Keeper. Turk is still waiting for Carla's answer to his proposal, and Dr. Townshend, an elderly doctor liked by everyone, runs into trouble with Dr. Kelso(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: His Story IV. The staff question Dr Kelso's commitment to the hospital, but a patient's war stories from Iraq remind Kelso what it means to be a good leader(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Karma. J.D. and Turk experience bad and good karma. Elliot and Paul take their relationship to the next level. Jordan goes into labor(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Midnight Ron. Archer and his stepfather are chased by gangsters(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Vicious Coupling. Archer's former fiancée asks him to help her cyborg boyfriend, who is trapped in outer space(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Once Bitten. Archer is bitten by a snake in his perineum (taint) and his subsequent venom-induced hallucinations uncover mysteries from his past, including the identity of his long-lost father(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: A Farewell to Arms. While hunting for a pair of pants, Fry stumbles upon a Martian prophecy which, according to Amy, reveals the world is going to end in 3012(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Decision 3012. Leela dabbles in politics when she manages a campaign for a presidential candidate, but the race is complicated by a missing birth certificate(n)

programme.title: Futurama

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Crime Family. The Mob is demystified in the A&E program American Justice: Crime Family. Host Bill Kurtis takes the viewer into the heart of the New York underworld to examine the long arms of the Genovese family. Started when Vito Genovese worked under Lucky Luciano, the notorious family has a firm grip on syndicated crime. A&E presents rare footage of the gangster clan and its shady leaders. For years, police have pursued the Genovese, but they remain frustratingly immune to arrest. Hear from the prosecutors who have made their capture a full-time job and the historians who will explain why the Genovese will never die(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.sub-title: Crime of Passion: The Pamela Smart Story
programme.desc: Crime of Passion: The Pamela Smart Story. Youth, seduction, and violence populate the landscape of the A&E program American Justice: Crimes of Passion -- The Pamela Smart Story. As an attractive motivated schoolteacher, Pam Smart was carving out a successful middle-class life. But, inwardly, she was passionately dissatisfied. Her husband held her back, yet she couldn't afford to live alone. Then, Smart met teenager Bill Flynn. He fell for her and she seemed flattered by the attention. Eventually, their relationship became intimate and Smart found the answer to all her problems. Through manipulation and claims of abuse, she convinced her young lover to kill her husband and that's just what he did with the help of two friends. But, Smart's calculating manner gave her away when police suspected her of being less than grief-stricken. What followed was the first live broadcast trial in history. The media explosion surrounding the case was unparalleled. Smart turned out to be a lot less organized than she thought. When her killers caved and word got around of her arranged hit, she was doomed. A&E takes the viewer back to the original trial of the century(n)

The construction, between 1938 and 1940, of Hitler's elaborate Siegfried Line, which consisted of a three-mile-deep series of fortifications, pillboxes and anti-tank obstacles. programme.desc: The manager of an apartment complex asks a Wall Street financier to manage pension funds for him and his friends, but the man pockets all the money instead. When he realises the fraudster is going to get away with the crime and the money will never be found, he enlists the help of a professional thief to steal it back. Crime comedy, with Ben Stiller, Eddie Murphy, Alan Alda, Tea Leoni, Casey Affleck and Matthew Broderick.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon helps Leonard drop off a parcel for Penny, but when he sees how messy her room is, he tries to do a good deed - which is not well received. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is upset to learn Penny is dating someone, so his friends and fellow scientists encourage him to seek a new romance by asking another woman out. Guest starring Sara Gilbert (Roseanne), with Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Animals in Love
programme.desc: In the second of two programmes about relationships in the wild, Liz Bonnin explores the ways in which animals get together. She observes a form of extreme flirting in a troop of capuchin monkeys in South America, which sees the females go to extraordinary lengths to attract the alpha male, reveals how African hyenas find it tough getting a girl and how an orang-utan in America chooses its partner in a very 21st-century way. For other animals, it turns out smell is a deal-breaker, while for others, it's all about having the best moves on the dance floor.(n)

programme.title: Monster Bug Wars
programme.desc: A giant rainforest mantis takes on a spiky leaf insect, and a Sydney funnel web spider attacks a garden wolf spider.(n)

programme.title: Biggest & Baddest
programme.desc: Niall McCann travels to a national park in Uganda to learn how some villagers are to blame for the decline in lion numbers.(n)

programme.title: Wild Canada
programme.desc: Polar bear cubs discover ice, a young caribou dances in the cold and eider ducks dive for mussels.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: An early dusting of snow signals the end of autumn, a time when the forests are a blaze of red and gold and the animals prepare for the coming cold. The elk face hungry wolves as they move down from the mountains to feed in the valleys, while beavers rush to defend their habitat against the destructive ice, repairing dams and stocking underwater larders before the waters freeze over.(n)

programme.desc: In the second of two programmes about relationships in the wild, Liz Bonnin explores the ways in which animals get together. She observes a form of extreme flirting in a troop of capuchin monkeys in South America, which sees the females go to extraordinary lengths to attract the alpha male, reveals how African hyenas find it tough getting a girl and how an orang-utan in America chooses its partner in a very 21st-century way. For other animals, it turns out smell is a deal-breaker, while for others, it's all about having the best moves on the dance floor.(n)

programme.desc: Locals and tourists in Rome find their lives intersecting. An architect tries to recapture his youth; an ordinary guy unexpectedly becomes famous; a couple is torn apart by new love interests; and an opera director urges a mortician to sing on stage(n)

programme.desc: A New England seaside town's tourist season is turned into a nightmare by a giant killer shark. The local police chief's efforts to protect the public are thwarted by the greedy mayor, forcing him to join forces with a grizzled fisherman and a marine biologist to hunt and kill the monster predator(n)

programme.title: Me, Myself & Irene
programme.desc: The Farrelly Brothers all-out comedy film stars Jim Carrey as Charlie, a nice-guy cop who's had a hard life - on his wedding day, his wife ran off with the wedding car driver, leaving him to bring up triplets. Fifteen years later, he's had enough of the jokes and jibes and out bursts Hank, a bad cop character who will bust anyone for anything. But then he and his long-suffering girlfriend Irene come across cop corruption and, pursued by the evil Lt Gerke, must go on the run, and need both Charlie and Hank's special skills to keep them alive(n)

programme.desc: Best Laid Plans. In the Season 1 finale, Ghost plans to hold a massive party at Truth in hopes of expanding out of NYC and the drug world(n)

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Adventure sequel. Treasure hunter Benjamin Franklin Gates seeks to discover the truth behind the assassination of Abraham Lincoln, by uncovering the mystery within the 18 pages missing from assassin John Wilkes Booth's diary(n)

programme.title: Death Wish
programme.desc: Brutal revenge thriller about a liberal New York architect who takes the law into his own hands after his family is attacked by muggers. Action(n)

programme.title: Candyman
programme.desc: Helen's attitude towards local myths and urban legends is cool to say the least, so when she hears about a hook-handed killer who supposedly stalks the streets at night and can be summoned by five chants of 'Candyman' into a mirror, she is naturally reluctant to believe the story. Instead, she decides to use the myth as a basis for her doctoral thesis. But as her investigations lead her to a recent murder which has been attributed to the Candyman, Helen's belief in what is possible and what is not is shaken. For she has uncovered a dark and sinister presence and soon finds herself the suspect in a murder enquiry. Based on a story by British horror maestro Clive Barker(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: The Battle of Bel Air. This episode introduces Marla Heasley in the role of Tawnia Baker, an intrepid reporter who becomes an unofficial member of the A-Team (it is explained that Tawnia's predecessor Amy Allen is "on assignment" overseas). Working undercover to expose a crooked security firm, Marla is kidnapped when she tumbles onto the firm's scheme to assassinate foreign dignitary Shiek Fatasi (Edward Ansara). Figuring they owe Marla a favor after she helped them escape the clutches of Col. Dexter (Lance LeGault), the A-Team races to her rescue. Future That 70s Show regular Kurtwood Smith is seen as a villain named Carson(n)

programme.title: The Last Legion
programme.desc: This epic sword-and-sorcery spectacle, set against the fall of the Roman Empire, follows the adventures of Rome's 12-year-old emperor and his battle against a ruthless warlord. Colin Firth and Ben Kingsley star. Aishwarya Rai, Peter Mullan. Directed by Doug Lefler(n)

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets

programme.title: Get Shorty
programme.desc: John Travolta shines in this adaptation of Elmore Leonard's novel about a movie-loving loan shark who pitches a story idea to a producer while collecting a debt(n)

programme.title: Face Off
programme.desc: Action thriller in which an FBI agent agrees to have the face of a captured international terrorist grafted onto his own head in order to discover the location of an enormous bomb. The plan goes awry when the terrorist, now having assumed the agent's face, escapes and destroys all evidence of the switch. A deadly cat-and-mouse game ensues(n)

programme.title: Face Off

The plan goes awry when the terrorist, now having assumed the agent's face, escapes and destroys all evidence of the switch. A deadly cat-and-mouse game ensues(n)

programme.title: Love and a .45
programme.desc: This action film has the feel of an old 1970's drive-in movie as it deals with the exploits of lovers on the run heading for the Mexican border. Watty-Watts believes himself to be an artist when it comes to executing robberies and demonstrates his art in the first scene. When Watty teams up with the crazed Billy Mack Black, a drugged out biker, his artistry fails and Billy fatally shoots the checkout girl which in turn, forces Watty to shoot him and run. Unfortunately, Billy didn't die and now is out for revenge. Watty, unknowing that his partner lives, gets his girlfriend Starlene and sets off across Texas for the Mexican border with Billy and the cops hot on their trail. The story makes many interesting detours before it comes to its inevitable conclusion(n)

programme.title: The Devil's Own
programme.desc: Controversial thriller about an Irish-American cop who wrestles with his conscience when he learns that his new lodger is an undercover IRA operative on a mission to buy weapons. The morally upright cop has sympathy for the young man's tragic past, but cannot condone his actions(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: Say It with Bullets. Female army corporal Charlotte Brown (Lauren Chase) hires the A-Team to investigate the murder of her brother Paul at the hands of illegal arms dealers. Imagine the team's surprise when Charlotte betrays them to their nemesis, Col. Decker (Lance LeGault). When it turns out that Charlotte had done this because Decker had promised to catch her brother's murderer, the Team decides to ( a ) rescue Charlotte and solve the mystery themselves, and ( b ) play Decker for a sucker by staging a fake attack on a National Guard outpost, using little more than a record of movie sound effects. And as a bonus, Murdock (Dwight Schultz) imagines that he is a TV set, spewing out ersatz sitcoms!(n)

programme.title: Officer Down
programme.desc: A corrupt cop gets a shot at redemption when the mystery man who saved his life during a botched drug bust seeks his help in stopping a madman who preys on strippers in this unapologetically gritty crime thriller. Meanwhile, the officer realizes that his shady past is about to catch up with him, and schemes to cover up his own role in the crimes(n)

programme.title: Spill
programme.desc: Action movie in which a United States Presidential bodyguard risks everything to save the day when a truck full of biological weapons crashes in a National Park(n)

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: When aliens mistake images of 1980s arcade games as a sign of aggression, they attack Earth with evil versions of Pac-Man, Donkey Kong and other video-game characters. In response, the US president asks his old gamer pals to battle the invaders(n)

programme.title: Reign Of Fire
programme.desc: Medieval fantasy meets futuristic science fiction in this effects-heavy action epic from former X-Files director Rob Bowman. In present-day London, 12-year-old Quinn Abercromby witnesses the awakening of a hibernating dragon from a centuries-long slumber, the result of a construction dig supervised by his mother and an incident for which Quinn feels partially responsible. Twenty years later, the adult Quinn (Christian Bale) is the fire chief of a refortified castle community, responsible for dousing the blazes lit by the dragon's prodigious number of flame-spewing offspring, airborne juggernauts that have wreaked havoc across the globe, torching civilization and turning humans into an endangered species. Hope arrives in the form of Denton "Dragon Slayer" Van Zan (Matthew McConaughey), an American known to be the only man to ever kill one of the dragons, and Alex (Izabella Scorupco), a scientist/pilot who's a member of Van Zan's army, a zealous fighting force that includes a secret weapon: the Archangels, paratroopers using themselves as bait to attract and then dispatch the deadly beasts. Reign of Fire (2002) co-stars Gerard Butler, Alice Krige, and Alexander Siddig(n)

programme.title: Officer Down

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: (2004) Set just three decades into the future, Alex Proyas's all-action science-fiction film is inspired by Isaac Asimov's 1950s short story. The science of robotics is so advanced that humanoid-looking servants have been developed, ready to obey any command from a human. When the chief designer of US Robotics, the biggest manufacturer of this new brand, is found dead in the company's atrium after a fall from the upper floor, it has all the hallmarks of suicide, and Chicago cop Del Spooner (Will Smith) is assigned to the case. But technophobe Spooner doesn't believe that all robots are harmless. Despite opposition from both his superiors and the company, he investigates further and soon his suspicions centre on one robot, Sonny (voiced by Alan Tudyk). Is "he" one of an army of conscious, violent robots ready to challenge their human masters? ; HD Wide(n)

programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Very, Very Old Man.
programme.desc: Stottlemeyer is thrown out by his wife and reluctantly goes to stay with Adrian. They both have difficulty adjusting to the arrangement, and find themselves permanently at loggerheads - until two very different murder investigations prompt them to set aside their differences. Tony Shalhoub and Ted Levine star.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The body of a saleswoman is found in the boot of a car at a luxury showroom, and an autopsy reveals she was run over. As inquiries proceed, the agents begin to suspect her boyfriend is to blame, but Jane is unconvinced and tries to draw the real murderer out into the open - only to end up destroying a Lamborghini. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Cho is forced to revisit old haunts and confront his murky past as he investigates the fatal shooting of a reformed criminal who used to belong to the same gang as him. Helped by Jane, he visits the victim's workplace to question his employer - but uses such heavy-handed tactics that he finds himself facing the threat of a lawsuit.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team members target a corrupt PR agent, plotting to use his own tactics to give him 15 minutes of fame. Once they have taken him public, the con artists plan to use his new-found celebrity to expose his hidden secrets. Crime drama, starring Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team sets out to track down a lost Vincent van Gogh painting, and discovers the missing piece was at the heart of a Second World War romance between a black soldier and the white heiress he was forced to abandon. Guest starring Danny Glover.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Confidential files are leaked by an anonymous hacker, who threatens to release more unless the Navy agrees to renew a contract with a struggling shipbuilding firm. The Navy Secretary suspects the company's owner Philip Wickes is to blame, and asks NCIS to join forces with the PsyOps unit in an elaborate ruse to bring the culprit out of hiding. Meanwhile, Gibbs' colleagues begin to notice his attraction to his opposite number Samantha Ryan. Guest starring Jamie Lee Curtis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Vance's brother-in-law Michael Thomas is linked to the murder of a petty officer, and Gibbs is placed under pressure to clear the man's name. Meanwhile, a negative performance review leaves Tony feeling downhearted and he resolves to prove the assessment wrong by being less chatty while on duty. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rocky Carroll.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A talented chef is poisoned during a culinary competition at an exclusive restaurant. After quizzing the other contestants, Jane discovers one of them encouraged the victim, a recovering alcoholic, to relapse in a bid to sabotage his chances, and learns he was in debt to a loan shark. However, it later emerges that a jealous partner could be to blame. Crime drama, guest starring Dina Meyer.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A scientist contacts Jane for help after being exposed to a deadly virus, leaving her with only a short time to live. He rushes to the facility where she works and compiles a list of possible suspects, including her husband - but later discovers the security systems have been tampered with, letting anyone enter the lab. It then emerges that a flask containing the toxin has been emptied in the staff room, threatening the entire team. Crime drama, guest starring Tony Curran (This Life).(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team infiltrates the corrupt world of corporate agriculture to recover an unlikely treasure - a one-of-a-kind stolen potato worth millions to the industry. Crime drama, starring Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: Nathan and his colleagues plot to steal a revolutionary computer chip from a hi-tech family home. However, they change course mid-heist when their target's young child is abducted while visiting the carnival. Crime drama, starring Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine lieutenant's body falls from the sky and the team links the man's death to the disappearance of a Navy chaplain thought to have been kidnapped by rebels working with Colombian crime cartels. Ziva and Tony are dispatched to conduct a rescue operation and enlist the help of former Interpol agent Monique Lisson, while Gibbs discovers there was more to the chaplain's outreach mission than meets the eye. Crime drama, guest starring Karina Lombard (The L Word) and Jamie Lee Curtis (A Fish Called Wanda).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A fire crew discovers a man's body after putting out a raging blaze at a warehouse belonging to a Navy-contracted electronics company, and Gibbs recognises the victim as Carter Plimpton - a former member of an NCIS black-ops unit. Meanwhile, a member of the Baltimore police department helping with the case appears to have a grudge against Tony.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan takes Francine to a baseball game to celebrate her birthday, but when the ground's `kiss cam' broadcasts their particularly horrible kiss to the rest of the spectators, Stan begins to question everything about his marriage. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger head to Nevada to help clean up polluted water. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter forms a neighbourhood-watch group, but is arrested and charged with a hate crime after shooting an intruder climbing into Cleveland's house.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve is upset when Snot threatens their summer camp fun by becoming a counsellor-in-training, and Roger comes up with an unusual way to celebrate Hayley and Jeff's anniversary.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Lois go into business together, opening a cookie store. However, tensions rise when Peter devises his own way of attracting more customers. Adult animation, featuring the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Alex Borstein.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg convinces Brian to take her SATs for her, but when she receives poor exam results everyone begins to question how smart the dog really is. Peter spends the day with the canine, showing him all the joys of being stupid, and the benefits of having a low IQ.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg is thrilled to be recruited as a model - but not everything is as it seems with the job. Meanwhile, Brian accompanies Stewie on a road trip adventure when the baby decides he wants to experience life outside of preschool.(n)

programme.title: Neon Joe, Werewolf Hunter
programme.desc: Joe tries to prove his innocence after he is imprisoned for the murder of his rival Plaid Jeff, and is forced to fight off a gang of skinheads. Comedy horror, starring Jon Glaser.(n)

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Ab episode inspired by the twist-filled films of M Night Shyamalan, in which Rick and Morty try to figure out a mystery. Guest starring David Cross.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine opens her own muffin shop when Stan fails to support her professional ambitions, giving her husband a taste of life without a housewife. In a desperate move, the inept agent transfers Klaus's brain back into a human body, but soon realises he has made a huge mistake. Meanwhile, Steve becomes convinced he is a teen werewolf.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan seeks revenge for an embarrassing incident at a high-school prom, in which he was humiliated on the dancefloor. His chance arrives when he attends a reunion with former homecoming queen Francine, but is devastated to discover two missing ballot papers mean that his wife never officially secured the crown.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve turns up at a baseball game wearing a Star Trek costume - much to the embarrassment of Stan, who refuses to be seen with him. However, a dental disaster forces a change of heart, and the pair team up to catch a terrorist at a sci-fi convention. Guest starring Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan reveals his real father is actually a super-suave spy and quits his job with the CIA to join him on an important mission. Francine is none too pleased with her husband's change of role and realises things are not quite what they seem when FBI agents show up looking for an international jewel thief.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Joe, Cleveland and Quagmire help throw Jesus an important birthday party after running into the Son of God at the Quahog Mall. Animation following the misadventures of America's disaster-prone Griffin family, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Stewie, Chris and Brian's Excellent Adventure.
programme.desc: Stewie and Brian use their time machine to help Chris pass his history test so he does not have to re-sit the whole year, but trouble ensues when the trio all get stuck in the past.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine fakes an affair to impress the glamorous Ladybugs, but finds they are not the kind of people she wants to be associated with. Stan, however, is happier with his new companion. American animated comedy, with the voices of Wendy Schaal and Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger and Stan have a blazing argument and exchange lives when the ensuing fight causes a Freaky Friday situation, giving them an insight into each other's problems, responsibilities and relationships. Elsewhere, Steve plucks up the courage to ask a girl out.(n)

programme.desc: A woman with amnesia is found stumbling out of a Native American reservation with severe head injuries, leading the agents to discover three dead bodies. programme.desc: Nathan and the team take aim at a charming funeral director, who they discover not only embezzles money from her grieving clients, but also sells the identities of the recently deceased to a Mexican drug cartel. Crime drama, starring Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart the Mother. A trip to the Springfield Family Fun Center proves to be a lucky one for successful bully Nelson Muntz (voice of Nancy Cartwright) when he wins a brand new BB gun, and Bart Simpson (also voiced by Cartwright), suitably impressed, asks if he can come over some time and try it out. Bart's mother Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) is aware of Nelson's thuggish tendencies and doesn't care for guns, so she forbids Bart to spend time with Nelson. Bart stops by his house after school anyway, and while trying out the gun accidentally kills a bird. Marge arrives just in time to see Bart in action, and rather than yell at her boy, she tells him she's given up on him. Bart senses he's finally crossed a dangerous line, and when he sees several unhatched eggs in the late bird's nest, he takes the back to his tree house in order to hatch them. While Bart tries to keep the egg-hatching project a secret, when Marge finds out it gives her a new faith in her son. However, when the eggs finally hatch, to the surprise of everyone what emerges aren't birds but Bolivian Tree Lizards, which have been declared a menace to wildlife by the U.S. Wildlife Department. "Bart The Mother" featured a voice cameo from Phil Hartman as Troy McClure in what proved to be his final appearance on the show; the episode first aired on September 27, 1998(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

Jean confirms that Hamm plays an FBI supervisor who Homer reports to when he becomes an undercover informant. And how did Hamm do? "You gave him one note and he immediately did 12 great things with it. He was really funny - and handsome. He had it all"(n)

She uses her newfound abilities to get revenge on her captors, but as the process continues, she evolves into something more than human. Sci-fi thriller, starring Scarlett Johansson and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.desc: As head of the fashion design agency Judy Inc., David Clemmer falls short in the taste department. Ezra and Julie dress up the agency's menu repertoire with easy, no-cook recipes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's cooks hearty breakfast biscuits that her husband and son are coming to collect on their way to feed the cattle.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond is sharing four vibrant recipes to celebrate the colours of summer.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's daughter Paige and her friend Stanton request Chinese food for their sleepover dinner, so Ree prepares an Asian-inspired feast.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond and her friend Hyacinth are throwing a graduation party for their daughters, and it is going to be the perfect send-off for the graduates.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Chefs Ed Baines and Valentine Warner reach the end of the culinary road trip in North Yorkshire, making date and walnut scones for the Nidderdale Show - where they face the scrutiny of judge Julie Clarke. They also visit Susannah Vickers, who runs a mobile service teaching people how to bake bread - and she has some hints and tips for the two professionals as well.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Jun Tanaka and Galton Blackiston set off on a culinary road trip to compete in cookery contests around the UK. They begin by putting their home-made pates up for scrutiny at the Hawkshead Show in Cumbria, where their offerings are judged by Mark Whitehead. The pair also meet prize-winning angler Les Mason and receive a quick fishing lesson.(n)

programme.title: Patricia Heaton Parties
programme.desc: Patricia's planning a big anniversary surprise for her unsuspecting husband, making bite-sized chicken and waffles, devilled eggs with caviar and a custom drink, the Silver Fizz.(n)

programme.title: Patricia Heaton Parties
programme.desc: Patty's making one of her favourite cocktails, The End Zone, as well as Cleveland stuffed potatoes, sloppy Joe pockets, kickoff cupcakes and sweet and savoury popcorn.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef shows how to create an Italian ham, nettle and spinach tart, a pie made with steak, Guinness and cheese, plus a traditional apple and blackberry pie.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to dishes using eggs collected from his hand-reared free-range hens. He creates a home-made tagliatelle, an omelette salad with bresaola, and a meringue with hot pears and chocolate sauce. He also starts some former battery hens off on their journey to a free-range life.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: The celebrity chef visits historic Sicilian capital of Palermo where he discovers its rich street culture and Arabic influenced food markets selling local specialities.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare a selection of meals in 16 minutes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond celebrates the things she loves on the ranch, and prepares a menu of bacon wrapped fillets, macaroni and cheese, and some cream-filled cupcakes.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Jun Tanaka and Galton Blackiston head to North Yorkshire on the second day of their culinary road trip and visit cheese producer David Hartley. The chefs then set up their kitchen to prepare savoury tartlets for the Wensleydale Show, where judge Pat Hesketh decides whether they make the grade.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Jun Tanaka and Galton Blackiston head to Northumberland on the third day of their culinary road trip and visit the Maxwells, local farmers who have diversified into the production of award-winning artisan cheeses and ice-cream. The chefs then set up their kitchen to prepare fruit tarts for the Glendale Show, where they try to win over judge Sue Burston.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: The children compete by creating a dish using boar, in the hope of impressing judges Christ Santos, actress Ali Larter and Food Network Star contestant Arnold Myint.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: The baker and celebrity chef travels to cities around the world to visit local bakeries and the bakers who work there.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of rhubarb, a plant that has been neglected in the UK even though the country produces some of the best crops in the world. The chef uses it as a foundation for a hot and sour dish with crispy pork and noodles, a ginger souffle and a creamy cocktail drink.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef reveals three simple ways to cook and dress asparagus, and demonstrates how best to use the vegetable in a meal. Gardener Brian also explains that once established, asparagus practically takes care of itself and can last for up to 20 years.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a child-inspired restaurant in Memphis that serves fried chicken, and a Thai restaurant in Hawaii that is known for its spicy dishes.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a summer shack in Narragansett that serves clam cakes cooked in beef fat, and a restaurant in St Louis that is known for its cheese fries and duck.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: This week, Jamie Oliver and Jimmy Doherty welcome chart-topping singer-songwriter Ellie Goulding to their pop-up cafe on Southend Pier, as their guest relives the junk food of her past by giving a burger a vegan twist. Jamie prepares an indulgent Japanese pork belly ramen, while Jimmy continues his mission to create a range of food with his DIY builds, reinventing the humble roast chicken with his own rotisserie. Plus, the boys revive a medieval tradition which was used to tackle the problem of farm waste.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel visits Mt. Ivy Cafe in Pomona, New York, and discovers that is may be the owner, rather than the staff, causing problems.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After losing thousands of dollars in unaccounted alcohol, the owner of Big Earl's Greasy Eats in Cave Creek investigates rumours of unauthorised late-night staff parties.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: While investigating a Phoenix eatery, the Mystery Diners encounter several problem employees who threaten patrons, drink on the job and eat customers' food.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: Ella and Stanley fear George's daft behaviour will lower the tone of their 40th wedding anniversary celebrations, so decide to bar him from the festivities. programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret are trapped in the shed by a swarm of escaped bees - and not unexpectedly where the mishap-prone Meldrews are concerned, that is just the start of their troubles. Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Afterthoughts of a Co-op Manager.
programme.desc: Truly discovers a former suitor of Marina's went off to Australia, and convinces her the emigrant did so to forget about her - and that she should stop seeing Howard out of respect to the other man's memory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Jean Fergusson and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Auntie Wainwright is thrilled to have picked up a bargain at the auction rooms, but puzzled as to what the object is. Worse yet, when she does find out what her purchase is meant for, she still has no idea what to do with it. Long-running comedy series, starring Jean Alexander, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An upset Howard becomes convinced he was abandoned as a baby after a few well-chosen words from Clegg, while Alvin is equally distraught that his newly constructed kite will not fly. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright attends a former customer's funeral, leaving Granville in charge of the store. However, the miserly shopkeeper has difficulty trusting his nephew to run it properly. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Ben forgets about Valentine's Day, but discovers Susan has a more attentive admirer. Comedy, guest starring Sam Kelly and Dan Renton Skinner, with Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The arrival of Clegg's cousin threatens to spell the end of the gang's gentle walks, so they resolve to get rid of him. Aubrey finds he can still beat Billy and Alvin cycling up hills, but discovers his own weakness. Starring Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Has Anyone Seen Barry's Midlife Crisis?.
programme.desc: Truly's plans to rescue Howard from his bedroom are given a boost when Auntie Wainwright puts some lightweight scaffolding up for sale - ideal for springing someone imprisoned on an upper floor. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Ben forgets about Valentine's Day, but discovers Susan has a more attentive admirer. Comedy, guest starring Sam Kelly and Dan Renton Skinner, with Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom Good decides he has had enough of commuting - but his alternative method causes embarrassment among the well-to-do neighbours. First episode of the classic comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Paul Eddington and Penelope Keith.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom and Barbara introduce livestock into suburban Surbiton - an idea that does not go down too well with the neighbours. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: The family has a spare invitation for the wedding, so Mrs Khan suggests giving it to the Parvez family. But her husband thinks the fewer guests the better and would rather have the influential Councillor Javed at the celebration. The decision is not an easy one to make - and to complicate matters, today just happens to be his own anniversary. Sitcom, starring Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.(n)

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: Rapid-fire comedy sketch show, featuring Paul Whitehouse, Charlie Higson, Arabella Weir and Caroline Aherne.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: A secretive phone call from a solicitor to Mrs Brown leaves her children suspecting one of them may be adopted, while Father Quinn returns from rehab and asks Agnes to help out at his annual garden party - although as she proceeds to drive him crazy with a smartphone, his recovery may be short-lived. Meanwhile, Cathy receives a blast from the past, Rory and Dino have a bust-up, and Mark and Betty deliver bad news - they are leaving for Australia right away. Domestic comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sean Lock, Lee Nelson and Ed Byrne.
programme.desc: Sean Lock hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, welcoming comedians to share their light-hearted views on modern life. Sean gives his take on female role models for his daughters, and introduces routines by Lee Nelson, who provides his views on street riots, and Irish funnyman Ed Byrne.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show

programme.title: Getting On
programme.desc: A graduate nurse drives a wedge between Den and Kim, Hilary's new hand-washing protocols cause frustration, and Pippa has to reapply for her own job. programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Battlechefs
programme.desc: Ten amateur celebrity cooks board a cruise ship heading across the Mediterranean, taking it in turns to command the kitchen. Using the cooking techniques they have acquired, each tries to impress chef and restaurateur Marco Pierre White. All competitors help prepare the meal, but also get a chance to score each other.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: With the cake week completed, and one of their number already eliminated from the competition, the 11 remaining home bakers must now prove their skill at making biscuits, a task that can be deceptively difficult, and one that has undone many a confident Bake Off contestant in the past. The opening signature challenge this week is to create 24 biscotti, Italian delicacies that must be baked twice to deliver the perfect crisp crunch. Next is Paul Hollywood's technical challenge, in which the contestants tackle Arlettes - labour-intensive, puff pastry-based treats from southwest France. Finally, for the showstopper, the judges demand bespoke edible biscuit boxes, filled with 36 biscuits of different flavours. After all three rounds have concluded, it falls to Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins to announce which of the bakers will be asked to leave the tent.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: After four weeks of competition, the 12 remaining contenders come together to compete in the semi-finals. They face an Invention test that features an abundant selection of meat, fish, fruit, vegetables and herbs and spices to choose from, but must go back to basics as all the modern machines are removed from the kitchen. Marcus Wareing, Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace then choose the best eight to go straight through, leaving the four weakest to cook off for the two remaining places in the competition.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create a gourmet party on a tight budget, preparing cut-price canapes, cakes and tasty treats, with Michelin-starred chef Nigel Haworth giving advice on vegetarian food. Finally, they put everything they have learned to the test when they arrange a surprise celebration for 35 farm volunteers.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip brings him to northern Greece where he enjoys traditional dishes including veal stiffado and kotopita - which Rick declares to be the best chicken pie he has ever tasted. In the coastal city of Preveza he goes out prawn fishing and follows in the footsteps of poet Lord Byron visiting Messolonghi, a city where seafood is a highly regarded commodity. Rick also rolls up his own sleeves to cook his favourite Greek dishes of stuffed peppers and tomatoes and souvlaki.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg and Chris help Clare and Richard from Hatfield, Hertfordshire, who are so busy with work and looking after two young children they have found themselves stuck in a rather unusual rut - seven years ago they devised a weekly meal plan - Monday is pizza, Wednesday is spaghetti bolognese and so on - and it hasn't changed since. Not only this, but they always buy big brands and premium supermarket ranges, which is an expensive way to shop for what has become a boring way to eat. Gregg and Chris are determined to help them - but breaking the family's habits isn't going to be easy.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Battlechefs
programme.desc: The celebrity cooks continue travelling across the Mediterranean, taking it in turns to command the kitchen and out-perform the opposition. Their talents are judged by chef and restaurateur Marco Pierre White.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 10 remaining home-bakers must steel themselves to face the full force of Paul Hollywood's discerning eye as Bread week arrives. For the signature bake, the contestants are given an hour-and-a-half to prepare quick breads with no proving - which results in creative flavours such as sweet chocolate loaves and manchego and prosciutto-stuffed bread coming to the fore. Next up is the technical challenge, in which Paul lulls the bakers into a false sense of security by asking them to make baguettes, a relatively simple task that concludes with `the male judge' delivering one of his most brutal verdicts yet. Finally, a bicycle, a snake, a lion and even Brighton Pavilion find their way into the tent's ovens as the showstopper challenge sees the competitors crafting edible 3D bread sculptures.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The first pair of semi-finalists are sent to Mayfair's Connaught Hotel to work a shift in the two Michelin-starred kitchen of French chef Helene Darroze, who then asks them to make her signature dish featuring calamari, blue lobster, clams, black squid ink, acquerello rice and Parmigiano-Reggiano foam. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti, who will pick one of them to go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create gourmet lunches on a tight budget, receiving tips from one of Britain's leading Indian chefs and getting insider advice on buying wine on a shoestring. Finally, they put everything they have learned to the test when they arrange a surprise meal for a dinner lady.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his 900-mile road trip from Venice to Istanbul, sampling that array of gastronomic delights that lie on the route. In the penultimate episode Rick arrives in the Greek Peloponnese where he samples mouth-watering dishes such as rooster stew hilopites with mizithra cheese, and a home-made moussaka he claims is the best he have ever savoured. In his Symi island kitchen, Rick rolls up his sleeves to prepare galaktoboureko, a dessert of semolina custard in filo pastry, a favourite dish in Greece.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: The Guests from Loughborough eat a diet of convenience food that is not only unwholesome, it is also very expensive. Mum Lisa is aware she has to make her family more healthy, but is going about it the wrong way, buying into costly `superfoods' rather than good old-fashioned fruit and veg. Can Gregg and Chris help the Guests bring more variety to their plates - and in turn, knock a whopping 50 per cent off their shopping bill? Along the way, they also investigate how canned fish compares to fresh and which oil is best for cooking, as well as the diet cons to watch out for.(n)

programme.title: High Maintenance
programme.desc: Grandpa. A Midwestern transplant experiences culture shock when he settles in Queens with his dog, but an eccentric dog walker makes them feel right at home(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: America's favourite family make their debut on the big screen in David Silverman's comedy. When Homer rescues a pig from certain death, little does he realise the full consequences of his action: Springfield will be isolated from the world by a gargantuan glass dome. It's the only way the government can prevent the pollution that he caused escaping to the outside world and creating a race of six-eyed squirrels. The townsfolk, armed with torches and pitchforks, are soon after him, and the family have to flee to Alaska. But even Homer knows he must return to do the right thing... Warning: contains full frontal male nudity(n)

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy stars in a comedy remake of the 1960s spy series of the same name. A CIA agent teams up with a boxer for a secret mission to recover a super-plane from Budapest(n)

programme.title: Suited
programme.desc: A look at a tailoring company in Brooklyn that provides custom attire for LGBTQ clients features profiles of the owners and the diverse community they serve. Lena Dunham and Jenni Konner ("Girls") are producers(n)

programme.title: Airheads
programme.desc: Sick and tired of being ignored by record industry executives, three none-too-bright heavy metal musicians take a local radio station hostage to demand airplay. This broad comedy lampoons both the music world and police hostage dramas as it depicts the musicians' quest for freedom and a record deal(n)

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy
programme.desc: A Southern matron forges a bond with her black chauffeur in the racially-divided 1960s South. Only when he is retired and she is confined to a home for the elderly do the two fully realize that they've been friends and kindred spirits all along(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: A young boy discovers a peculiar island, where he finds a community of children with special abilities, after following a sequence of clues and must protect them(n)

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg returns to the calling, as a singer helping the nuns run an inner-city school(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Sam Witwicky wants his life back. After saving the universe of destruction in a battle between two warring races of robotic aliens, he wants to study at the University and spend the last moments before leaving with his girlfriend Mikaela. But avoiding his fate is not going to be an easy task to fulfill because an ambitious man of the government will put the world again in danger and start another round of the war between good and evil. The visions will return to Sams brain and he is not going to be able to ignore them. Despite he did not really want to, he finds himself back with his friends in the middle of a battle between the Autobots and Decepticons, and with the future of the whole universe in his hands(n)

programme.desc: Taking Back Iraq & Lost Generation. Aris Roussinos reports on the battle for Mosul between ISIS and a U.S.-supported coalition of Iraqi and Kurdish troops; Isobel Yeung examines the state of Iraqi youth growing up surrounded by war and chaos(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: The Patent Troll. Richard decides to stand up to a patent troll, but his defiance comes back to haunt him; Gilfoyle goes to extremes to battle Jian-Yang's new smart fridge; Jared embraces multiple identities in an effort to reduce costs; Erlich mixes with a group of alpha males(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane (Margot Robbie) in London, Tarzan (Alexander Skarsgård) is forced to return to the Congo in order to act as a trade representative for England. However, he soon clashes with a greedy Belgian captain (Christoph Waltz) who has sinister plans for his old home. David Yates directed this adaptation of Edgar Rice Burroughs' classic tales. Samuel L. Jackson, Djimon Hounsou, John Hurt, and Jim Broadbent co-star(n)

programme.title: If You're Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast
programme.desc: Carl Reiner seeks out some of his nonagenarian friends, including Norman Lear, Mel Brooks, Betty White, Dick Van Dyke, Stan Lee and Iris Apfel—and even a few centenarian ones—to discuss the secrets of their longevity and still-active lifestyles. Tony Bennett performs the film's opening title song, "The Best Is Yet to Come."(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: "The question is what happens AFTER you walk off into the sunset," is the poser Bridget Jones is fretting over after snaring Mark Darcy. On the plus side, there's been a romantically-blissful six weeks of seventy-one "ecstatic shags" with the mega-mannered human rights lawyer. But on the downside, Bridget still needs a calculator to calorie count and feels ill-at-ease in Darcy's world of soaring legal eagles and black-tie dinners(n)

programme.title: Spring Breakdown
programme.desc: Gayle, Becky and Judi are three thirty-something friends who decide to break the monotony of their lives by vacationing on an island that's a popular spring break getaway for college coeds. One of them works for a powerful senator, and is also on a mission to prevent his daughter from embarrassing her family, only the girl is as geeky as her chaperones(n)

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: New Mexico rodeo buddies buck the system and head to New York in search of a missing friend(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Alien: Covenant'
programme.desc: A look at "Alien: Covenant," a 2017 sci-fi thriller about a spaceship crew that encounters dangerous creatures while exploring a seemingly idyllic world. The film stars Michael Fassbender, Katherine Waterston and Billy Crudup, and is directed by Ridley Scott(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A witty script and a great ensemble cast add up to one of Woody Allen's most hilarious farces. Allen wrote, directed and stars as a washed-up filmmaker who is suddenly stricken with psychosomatic blindness on the eve of his big comeback(n)
