programme.desc: Actor_list_: starring Fardeen Khan, Esha Deol, Mukul Dev, Kiron Kher, Rohit Roy and others(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: This spin-off of Snow White and the Huntsman acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman (Chris Hemsworth) as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna (Charlize Theron) and Freya (Emily Blunt). During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara (Jessica Chastain), since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom. Directed by Cedric Nicolas-Troyan(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: Steve Carell is Maxwell Smart, a covert agent who often finds himself out of his depths but never out of options. It's CONTROL veruss KAOS all over again as this action comedy based on a beloved hit TV series from the sixties pits Agent 86 against a nuclear scheme by the evil spy conglomerate. Partnered with sexy and capable Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway), he navigates the world of multifunction pocketknives and exploding dental floss to hilarious effect. The all-star cast is rounded up by Dwayne Johnson, Terence Stamp, Alan Arkin and James Caan(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage is the slick financier who usually wakes up to a blonde and the Wall St Journal. But not today, because angel Don Cheadle gives him a glimpse of what might have been, with kids, a wife and a job selling tires(n)

programme.title: 10,000 B.C.
programme.desc: When a band of mysterious horse-riding warlords raid the Yaghal camp and kidnaps the beautiful Evolet along with many others, young mammoth hunter D'Leh is forced to lead a small group of hunters south to save her. Driven by destiny, the unlikely band of warriors must also battle saber-toothed cats and terror birds(n)

Olivia Williams, Seymour Cassel, Brian Cox, Mason Gamble(n)

programme.title: Every Brilliant Thing
programme.desc: Jonny Donahoe performs in a one-person play about a man who came of age with a suicidal mother but, at various stages of his life, set about compiling a long list of reasons to live. Filmed at the Barrow Street Theatre in New York City in 2015(n)

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: This feel-good ensemble comedy tracks a quartet of suburban siblings and their families over the course of a single summer. Hardworking Gil Buckman (Steve Martin) and his stay-at-home wife, Karen (Mary Steeenburgen), have just a few months to help their oldest son, Kevin (Jasen Fisher), overcome his high-strung behavior problems before he'll be relegated to special-education classes. Gil's difficult relationship with his own father, Frank (Jason Robards), has led him to become a would-be super-dad for his three kids, so he takes his son's difficulties more than a little personally. Gil's sister, Helen (Dianne Wiest), is trying to raise a moody, adolescent son (Leaf Phoenix) and an independent-minded daughter (Martha Plimpton) with no help from her well-off ex-husband, who's more interested in his new wife and family. Gil and Helen's sister, Susan (Harley Jane Kozak), meanwhile, must participate in the too-scripted Big Life Plans of her anal-retentive husband, Nathan (Rick Moranis), whose overachiever zeal infects even their toddler daughter. When long-lost brother Larry (Tom Hulce) show up with yet another get-rich-quick scheme, he brings with him a surprise addition to the family. Screenwriters Babaloo Mandel, Lowell Ganz, and Ron Howard negotiate their varied subplots with a deftness and comedic touch that transforms this conflicted clan into a suburban everyfamily(n)

programme.title: The English Patient
programme.desc: Nine Oscars went to this drama about an injured World War II cartographer who reveals his affair with a married woman to his caring nurse(n)

programme.title: Term Life

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Hugely successful businesswoman Michelle Darnell (Melissa McCarthy) is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she is forced to move in with a long-suffering employee of hers (Kristen Bell), and tries to earn redemption and revamp her public image by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies. Peter Dinklage, Kristen Schaal, and Kathy Bates co-star in this comedy, which was directed by Ben Falcone (McCarthy's real-life husband), and co-written by McCarthy, Falcone, and Steve Mallory(n)

Serial killer Vincent D'Onofrio is in custody but in a coma and unless she can unlock the secrets of his mind, an imprisoned girl will be his next victim in hours. programme.desc: A lethal virus spreads throughout Scotland, infecting millions and killing hundreds of thousands. To contain the threat, acting authorities brutally quarantine the country as it succumbs to fear and chaos. Three decades later, the Reaper virus violently resurfaces in London. An elite group of specialists is urgently dispatched to retrieve a cure by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: The youngest child of the family often has the most problems -- so why should things be different for the Prince of Darkness and his offspring? Satan (Harvey Keitel) is considering retirement, and is pondering which of his sons should take over the family business -- ambitious Adrian (Rhys Ifans), strapping Cassius (Tommy "Tiny" Lister Jr.), or Nicky (Adam Sandler), an accident-prone demon who prefers to stay in his room playing his favorite heavy metal tunes. When Satan decides to stay on for another 10,000 years, Adrian is outraged, and leaves Hell to go to New York, where he and Cassius attempt to round up enough souls to vote Satan out of power. Satan, understandably upset, sends Nicky to bring Adrian and Cassius back home, but Nicky finds life on Earth is more complicated than he expected. Things don't get any easier when he develops a crush on Valerie (Patricia Arquette), a good-hearted mortal woman. Little Nicky also features Michael McKean as a city official trying to put Nicky behind bars, Kevin Nealon as Hell's gatekeeper, Rodney Dangerfield as Satan's father, Robert Smigel as the voice of Beefy -- a talking dog who is Nicky's guide on earth, Allen Covert as Todd -- Nicky's new roommate, and Peter Dante and Jonathan Loughran as a pair of metalheads who dig Satan. Jon Lovitz and Reese Witherspoon play cameo roles, and Regis Philbin and Ozzy Osbourne appear as themselves(n)

programme.title: Puerto Ricans in Paris

programme.title: The Bachelor
programme.desc: Jimmie is seeing his single friends get married one by one. Not something he's worried about, until his current girlfriend Anne catches the bouquet at his friend Marco's wedding. Feeling his wild partying days are numbered, he proposes to Anne, but botches the proposal so badly that Anne leaves town, insulted by his apparently defeatist attempt to tie the knot. After she's gone, Jimmie discovers that his recently-deceased grandfather's will stipulates he gets nothing of a multi-million dollar fortune unless he's married by 6.05pm on his 30th birthday, the very next day! Can he beat the clock in time to claim his inheritance?(n)

programme.title: Dragon Blade

programme.title: Airheads

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: Four women with vastly different ideas about love and relationships navigate the single life of New York City. Taking a break from her long-term boyfriend Josh (Nicholas Braun), Alice (Dakota Johnson) sets out on a journey of self-discovery with her hard-drinking new friend Robin (Rebel Wilson). Meanwhile, Alice's career-driven older sister Meg (Leslie Mann) struggles with the idea of settling down, and uptight romantic Lucy (Alison Brie) searches for her perfect match. Adapted from former Sex and the City writer Liz Tuccillo's debut novel, this modern rom com was directed by Christian Ditter(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Jamal Malik is one question away from winning 20 million rupees in the Indian version of the TV quiz show Who Wants to Be A Millionaire?. As he answers correctly one question after another, the producers suspect he is cheating and have him arrested. The police agents questioning him cannot believe that a slumdog like him can have the knowledge to win the prize and become a millionaire overnight. While trying to prove them it is destiny that placed him there, Jamal will take us back to the events of his childhood that have the clue to the answers. We will learn about how he and his little brother strived to survive in the mean streets of Mumbai and how he met Latika, his one true love. He entered the show knowing she would be watching it and now every question brings him closer to her(n)

programme.title: The Good Guy
programme.desc: After executive producing the acclaimed documentary Manda Bala and the J.M. Coetzee adaptation Disgrace, Julio DePietro makes his feature debut as a writer-director with The Good Guy, a drama about ambitious young Wall Streeters fighting each other -- and sometimes their own decent nature -- to get ahead in the world. Our narrator, Tommy (Scott Porter of TV's Friday Night Lights), is young, clever, charming, and attractive. He's got a smart, pretty girlfriend, Beth (Alexis Bledel of Gilmore Girls), an urban conservationist. He's also very good at his investment broker job, impressing his ruthless, cynical boss, Cash (erstwhile "Brat Pack" member Andrew McCarthy). When a key member of Tommy's sales team suddenly leaves for a competitor, Tommy needs to fill his spot quickly, and takes a chance on the bumbling Daniel (Bryan Greenberg, Bride Wars), a former Marine and computer geek who seems a bit naïve about high finance and a bit nervous around women. Tommy takes Daniel under his wing, showing him how to dress, where to socialize, and how to charm attractive women. Their relationship is threatened when Daniel begins spending more time with Beth, joining her book club, and becoming her confidant. Tommy begins to question his decision to share his wisdom with Daniel, while Daniel is forced to decide what success really means to him, and where his loyalties lie. The Good Guy also stars Anna Chlumsky (In the Loop) and Aaron Yoo (Disturbia). The film had its world premiere at the 2009 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

Unfortunately for Monk, Wagner has an alibi that is literally air-tight: At the time of Joanne's death, he was in outer space! Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. programme.title: Judge Rinder's Crime Stories
programme.desc: New series. Barrister Robert Rinder recalls arguably the most audacious robbery in British criminal history, when in November 2000 an armed gang tried to steal the priceless Millennium Star diamond on display at the Millennium Dome, south-east London. Plus, the case of gamekeeper Billy Stirrat, whose life was turned upside down following a miscarriage of justice involving his wrongful arrest for the possession of £500,000 worth of amphetamine.(n)

programme.title: Masterpiece with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan and auctioneer Rachel Houston-Holland visit Lydiard House in Wiltshire, where they invite three teams of enthusiasts to compete to find the most rare and valuable items. At the end of the show each team reveals what its members think is the masterpiece and whoever chooses the most masterpieces wins £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as another four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but anyone caught by the Chaser is out for good, leaving fewer players to team up and play in the final chase.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Finn goes on his first job as an escort, but panics and ends up trying to steal the client's money and run away - then resorts to threats when he gets caught. Rakesh is unnerved as word spreads about what really happened at the mill, while Belle is devastated to discover that Lachlan is more interested in Sookie than her.(n)

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: For many people, buying a new-build home is the realisation of a long-held dream. But complaints about poor workmanship and controversial leasehold contracts are on the rise. Jonathan Maitland investigates.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Ross catches up with Finn at Wylie's farm, and is distressed by his brother's situation. He offers to find a way to resolve the family's financial crisis, and almost immediately discovers one, when the brothers stumble on a large-scale cannabis growing operation. Priya gets found out, and Charity confronts Faith.(n)

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Postcards
programme.desc: The actress recalls the second half of her journey along the Nile. She learns how the waters at the source of the river in Uganda are believed to have powers of healing - and gets accidentally baptised. Joanna also goes on safari, where she encounters shoebills, hippos, rhinos and crocodiles, attends an early morning service at one of the many monasteries and samples the national dish. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: It'll Be Alright on the Night
programme.desc: Griff Rhys Jones returns to showcase another selection of hilarious film and TV outtakes rescued from the cutting-room. Among the stars whose gaffes are highlighted in this edition are Elton John, David Beckham and Ricky Gervais, and fumbled takes from the sets of Coronation Street, Mr Selfridge and EastEnders also make an appearance. Plus, mistakes from The One Show demonstrate the perils of live TV, and Jeremy Kyle has a painful encounter with a stray camera.(n)

programme.title: ITV News Election Night: The Results
programme.desc: As the polls close, News at Ten anchor Tom Bradby presents live through-the-night coverage of the battle for Number 10, revealing who will lead the country for the next five years. He is joined in the studio by ITV political editor Robert Peston and two political analysts - Professor Jane Green, a director of the British Election Study and Professor Colin Rallings, ITV's election analyst for nearly 30 years. Regional correspondents report from the key constituencies as the votes are counted, with commentators in the studio sharing their interpretation of the results as they happen - and what happens next - while Nina Hossain charts how the election is being followed online with social media partners and a gathering of guests.(n)

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Susanna Reid, Piers Morgan, Charlotte Hawkins and Kate Garraway present an extended edition, with reports on the General election outcome led by the programme's political editor Ranvir Singh.(n)

programme.title: Election 2017: ITV News Special
programme.desc: Julie Etchingham presents the key developments and reaction to the results of the snap General Election, with expert analysis from correspondents in Westminster and across the country. programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the 12th day's play at Roland Garros, including the women's semi-finals in the second Grand Slam tournament of the year. At this stage 12 months ago, Serena Williams made it to her fourth singles final here with a 7-6, 6-4 victory over Kiki Bertens. In the other match, Garbine Muguruza recorded an impressive 6-2, 6-4 win against Samantha Stosur to set up a repeat of the 2015 Wimbledon final. Today's schedule is also set to include the mixed doubles final and the semi-finals of the men's doubles. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.desc: Herbert Armstrong finds himself under great pressure from business rival Oswald Martin and considers the use of arsenic as a way out of his problems once more. Conclusion of the fact-based drama, starring Michael Kitchen, David Thewlis and Lesley Sharp.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Cardale prepares for Andrew and Erica's wedding, but a health scare at the local old people's home tests everyone to the limit. Rural medical drama, starring Gary Mavers and Fiona Gillies.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress investigates missing golf balls, and some lads break into a local war hero's home. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack and Christine's relationship begins to cause problems for the team, who are still reeling from the death of Yvonne, while Sam makes a shocking confession and Robert goes on the warpath. Mike's chances of getting the registrar job are jeopardised by his recent mistake, and Cathy's departure leaves him feeling even worse. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective's curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. When the vessel arrives at Alexandria, the irritating lady's body is discovered in her cabin - leaving the sleuth with a host of possible suspects to interrogate. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Aircraft manufacturer Lord Mayfield hosts a party to trap a woman suspected of being a spy for the Germans. Fearing events might not go according to plan, Lady Mayfield decides to summon the famous Belgian detective to keep an eye on proceedings. Starring David Suchet, with John Stride and Phyllida Law.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel discovers her ex-partner is the defending barrister for Georgios Stelikos, a man on trial for rape and murder, and she is horrified when the accused escapes conviction. When Stelikos is later found dead, the prime suspect is Hannah Conway, who made public death threats against him after giving evidence for the prosecution in court. Meanwhile, Janet tries to support her colleague following devastating news. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Three weeks after reporting her husband missing, adult-film star Vicky Birkinshaw is arrested on suspicion of his murder. Rachel faces the task of going through the suspect's home-made pornography collection in search of clues, but the case takes a dark twist when Vicky's daughter turns up with her much older boyfriend. Meanwhile, Janet's affair with a colleague is exposed. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran.(n)

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: In 1935, beleaguered Bournemouth mother Louisa Durrell decides to uproot her family and build a new life on the sun-drenched island of Corfu. However, with money problems and four unruly children to care for, even a new start might not be enough to banish her troubles. Period drama, starring Keeley Hawes, based on Gerald Durrell's trilogy of Corfu memoirs, which includes My Family and Other Animals.(n)

programme.title: Homefront
programme.desc: The day of Matt's inquest has arrived and Paula wants answers. Her son Tom is sent home from Afghanistan to give evidence about his brother's death and commanding officer Pete advises him to stick to his original witness statement. The question is, will Tom toe the line or tell the truth and risk hurting those he loves the most?.(n)

programme.title: Breathless
programme.desc: In the wake of the patient's death, Charlie fears he will be struck off with nobody to defend him at the inquiry, while Otto is called away for the night to attend a complicated birth in Dorset, and seizes the opportunity to ask Angela to join him on the trip. Mulligan offers to give up the incriminating files if Elizabeth agrees to a very personal request, and Jean hosts a dinner party, to Richard's horror.(n)

programme.title: Band of Gold
programme.desc: The women's old enemy George Ferguson falls foul of local heavies and buys his life by offering them a chance to launder illicit cash through the women's cleaning business. Gritty drama, starring Geraldine James, Barbara Dickson and Cathy Tyson.(n)

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: A vital report is stolen from the home of a government minister, putting the reputation of high-ranking French officials at stake. Drama, starring Michael Gambon.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack and Christine's relationship begins to cause problems for the team, who are still reeling from the death of Yvonne, while Sam makes a shocking confession and Robert goes on the warpath. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Dandelion Dead

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Cardale prepares for Andrew and Erica's wedding, but a health scare at the local old people's home tests everyone to the limit. Rural medical drama, starring Gary Mavers and Fiona Gillies.(n)

programme.title: The Glass
programme.desc: Things are looking rosy for Carol and Proctor, who have recently become engaged, but Duggan is not so easily swayed from his devious plans and begins to work his charm on Carol, as well as working on a deal that could spell the end of Albery Glass forever. Drama, starring John Thaw, Sarah Lancashire and Joseph McFadden.(n)

programme.title: The Glass

programme.title: Inspector Wexford

programme.title: Peak Practice

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The new sergeant's arrival could mean radical changes for Greengrass, and everyone is under suspicion when a girl reports a stalker in the village.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone

Mike clashes with Robert over a patient he dismissed as just another drug addict when it turns out the youngster is suffering from sickle cell anaemia. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack, David Harewood and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Aircraft manufacturer Lord Mayfield hosts a party to trap a woman suspected of being a spy for the Germans. Fearing events might not go according to plan, Lady Mayfield decides to summon the famous Belgian detective to keep an eye on proceedings. Starring David Suchet, with John Stride and Phyllida Law.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An actress engaged to marry a foreign prince becomes the police's number one suspect in the murder of a shady producer. Desperate to ensure she escapes prosecution, her wealthy fiance asks Poirot to catch the real killer. Unfortunately, the celebrated detective ends up concluding she has lied - or is an accomplice. David Suchet stars, with Niamh Cusack, Abigail Cruttenden and Sean Pertwee.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: Cold Is the Grave - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The detective is drawn into the criminal underworld of Soho when he reluctantly accepts an unofficial request from Chief Superintendent Rydell to find his missing daughter. Meanwhile, an armed robbery in Eastvale turns into a murder investigation after the perpetrator is found dead in his home and when a battered body is found in a local nightclub, the identity of the victim leads Banks and Cabbot to a devastating realisation about both cases.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: Cold Is the Grave - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. A surveillance operation establishes a clear link between the murders of Charles McKay and Barry Clough and the subsequent investigation takes a number of alarming twists before uncovering a conspiracy pointing to one of the team being an informer. As Banks pushes all the suspects hard, the case threatens to undermine his integrity as an officer and brings his relationship with Cabbot to breaking point. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Prime Suspect 1973
programme.desc: Bradfield sees a chance to get revenge on Clifford and diverts the team to carry out surveillance on the Bentleys - and when Tennison learns of the operation, she is forced to make a split-second decision as to what is most important, her career or her family? As Bradfield uncovers more details about the heist, he faces the disapproval of his colleagues as he becomes determined to catch them in the act.(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Band-Aid Covers the Bullet Hole. Bailey (Chandra Wilson) refuses to stay on maternity leave, saddling a reluctant Cristina (Sandra Oh) with babysitting duty--as if Cristina doesn't have enough trouble with Burke (Isaiah Washington). Meredith (Ellen Pompeo) has yet to get over her night with George (T.R. Knight), while Derek (Patrick Dempsey) and Addison (Kate Walsh) can't get past the problem of Mark Sloan. In a similar "triangle" situation, Alex (Justin Chambers) feels like the proverbial fifth wheel out as Izzie (Katherine Heigl) and Denny (Jeffrey Dean Morgan) grow closer. Meanwhile, the roster of patients is a strange one indeed, ranging from a terminal ill woman (Anne Moore) with a fork stuck in her neck, and a hockey player (Teddy Dunn) who demands that Callie (Sara Ramirez) amputate his least useful finger(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Superstition. A rash of deaths at Seattle Grace brings out the doctors' superstitious sides, especially Izzie, who fears the worst about Denny's surgery. Meanwhile, Derek and Addison rethink their living arrangement, and Richard treats an old friend(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: The Name of the Game. George begins to overstay his welcome. Meredith learns a secret about her father. Bailey is worried she will be treated differently now she is a mother. Alex gets a lesson in bedside manners(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Under Pressure. An overview of the series(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Blues for Sister Someone. Izzie (Katherine Heigl) tries again to get to know the "real" George (T.R. Knight), with minimal success. Derek (Patrick Dempsey) has a revealing discussion with divorce attorney Gwen Graber (Jayne Brooks). Addison (Kate Walsh) treats a staunchly Catholic woman (Rose Ward) who, after bearing seven children, has decided to secretly have her tubes tied--only to look on in horror as the ever-tactless Alex (Justin Chambers) spills the beans to the woman's family. And Burke (Isaiah Washington) attempts to talk sense to his idol, concert violinist Eugene Foote (Albert Hall), who demands that his pacemaker be removed immediately(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Damage Case. Derek's mad at Meredith, and Burke's mad at Cristina. Meanwhile, Burke and Izzie make a new suggestion to a depressed Denny; and the doctors treat a family involved in an auto accident(n)

programme.title: Catastrophe
programme.desc: Rob Delaney and Sharon Horgan write and star in Catastrophe, a new six-part comedy that follows an American man and an Irish woman who make a bloody mess as they struggle to fall in love in London. Scorching chemistry, instant pregnancy, and genuine disaster provide the foundation for this flaming hovel of a relationship. Can Sharon, 'an extraordinarily good-smelling woman', and Rob, 'a sturdy love-maker', navigate the increasingly thorny situations they find themselves in and still find time for an emergency shag in a stairwell?(n)

programme.title: Catastrophe
programme.desc: Rob Delaney (comedian and best-selling author) and Sharon Horgan (award-winning actress and star/ co-writer of Pulling) write and star in Catastrophe, a new six-part comedy that follows an American man and an Irish woman who make a bloody mess as they struggle to fall in love in London. In episode two, Sharon faces the reality of having a giant new room-mate in the form of Rob, the man whose child she happens to be carrying. She introduces him to her brother Fergal (Jonathan Forbes) who gives them both a royal hard time. Rob connects with an old school pal Dave (Daniel Lapaine), who's evolved into a delightful scumbag. Rob then endeavours to cook up a proper proposal to help Sharon feel better about the clumsiness of their situation. Writers: Rob Delaney, Sharon Horgan; Prod: Jack Bayles;(n)

programme.title: Catastrophe
programme.desc: Rob Delaney and Sharon Horgan write and star in Catastrophe, a new six-part comedy that follows an American man and an Irish woman who make a bloody mess as they struggle to fall in love in London. In episode three, pregnant Sharon's hormones plague her with waves of horniness and sadness and a host of other fears. Rob has difficulty generating advertising business since he knows almost no one in London. Sharon has a chance meeting with an old flame, which leads to dinner, while Rob begins a clandestine friendship affair with Chris (Mark Bonnar), who is married to a woman Sharon can't stand(n)

programme.title: Catastrophe
programme.desc: Rob Delaney (comedian and best-selling author) and Sharon Horgan (award-winning actress and star/ co-writer of Pulling) write and star in Catastrophe, a six-part comedy that follows an American man and an Irish woman who make a bloody mess as they struggle to fall in love in London. In episode four, still getting to know each other, Rob and Sharon continue to enjoy a vigorous sex life. Sharon's parents visit from Ireland and have a strained introduction to Rob. More health complications arise, jeopardising Sharon's pregnancy and creating stress for them both. Rob's secret friendship with Chris (Mark Bonnar) explodes in his face in a way he could never have imagined, and Sharon receives a visitor. Writers: Rob Delaney, Sharon Horgan; Prod: Jack Bayles; Dir: Ben Taylor; Exec Prods: Jon Thoday, Richard Allen-Turner; Kara Baker, Sharon Horgan, Rob Delaney; Prod Co: Avalon Television(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Chris James and Susan Spencer from Norfolk find their dream waterfront holiday home in Tampa, Florida. The couple have a budget of £150,000, and are hoping to find a place their entire family will enjoy.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick and the team deal with two emergency cases in this edition. Lara the cat went missing after jumping into a removal van, but escaped, only to be hit by a car and then attacked by a fox. One of its rear legs is shattered and the vet has to perform reconstructive surgery to rebuild it. Chief, an eight-year-old Northern Inuit, dislocated its hip while chasing a fox. Noel thinks it needs hip-replacement surgery, but owner Nigel can't afford to pay for the operation.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Claire Hilton, who runs Robertsbrook Guest House in Swanage, Dorset, feels she has a good chance of winning the title of best B&B as another round of the competition gets under way. However, guests Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome have doubts over the cleanliness of their bedroom, and another couple are accustomed to more opulent surroundings.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome hope to impress with their two-star B&B Eden Lodge in Falmouth, Cornwall. However, the state of their property disappoints their fellow competitors. At dinner, James and Maria Church reveal the truth about their famous daughter Charlotte, and the following morning's breakfast reduces some of the guests to fits of giggles.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It is the turn of Charlotte Church's parents James and Maria to play host at Dexby Townhouse in Cardiff, and they pull out all the stops by laying on a day of white-water rafting and a magic performance courtesy of their nephew Elliot. But the following morning, some of the guests are kept waiting for breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Newlyweds Pip Easby and Nicky Lesser-Easby, who run Muddifords Court Country House in Devon, open their doors for the final stay of the competition. The Churches find their four-poster bed too small, and not all the guests enjoy their trip to a local glass-blowing factory, but feedback at check-out time leaves the hosts feeling confident.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. An underpayment from a surprising source changes the dynamics of the group and throws the competition wide open, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Cape Coral in Florida, where he tries to help Tim Morris and his partner Elaine find their dream waterfront property on a budget of £300,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple disagree over where to spend their retirement, with husband Michael hoping to set up home in Derbyshire, where he will be able to indulge his passion for the British countryside. Conversely, his wife Susan would like to spend her time relaxing by a pool in the Spanish sun, and it is left up to Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman to help them decide where to spend their £180,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit Northamptonshire, where they expect to find the remains of a Norman hunting lodge. However, the results prove confusing - the buildings they uncover are clearly too small for the lodge, but since the forests were protected, it remains a mystery what other structure would have been built there. Scouring the Domesday Book for clues, they also learn a large number of pigs were kept on the site, suggesting this could have been one of the world's first factory farms.(n)

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Brunel's Last Launch: A Time Team Special.
programme.desc: Archaeologists scour the banks of the Thames to examine the site of the disastrous launching of Isambard Kingdom Brunel's SS Great Eastern in 1858. Tony Robinson joins them as the team inspects the slipways to ascertain the reason for the disaster and how it affected shipbuilding in London.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Two-year-old Labrador Ira is fitted with a bionic spine, while anxious owner Rob brings in eight-year-old French bulldog Tom with a long list of chronic ailments. Matt and Rebecca arrive at the clinic with their three-year-old cat Marley, who may need to have a leg amputated.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Suffolk to secretly restore a charismatic but worn-out 1928 Austin 12 Tourer. Despite its many problems, the duo are confident that they can repair the grand old dame of the road.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: In 2010, Claire Farrow and Ian Hogarth built a home containing a sauna, spa, dance floor and DJ booth on a small patch of land in Kensington, central London. It was a notorious project with several setbacks - including their digger smashing into a neighbour's wall and the re-emergence of the old river under the building. These threatened to prevent them completing the project, but two years later Kevin McCloud revisits the duo to see how things have progressed.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: This edition explores the challenges that inevitably come with the end of life, and how the emergency services have to learn to cope when dealing with death on a daily basis. In Warrington, paramedics arrive at the home of a man having a suspected cardiac arrest, and with CPR already being carried out and a defibrillator at close hand, the man is given the best possible chance of survival. Plus, ambulance staff and police officers discuss being called to sudden deaths.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A man with schizophrenia is admitted for the 19th time in a year after failing to take his diabetes medication. Meanwhile, a former betting-shop manager and a 16-year-old both suffer suspected strokes - the 61-year-old, once known as the `memory man', is now coming to terms with his diminishing mental capabilities, while the teenager's identical twin and mother wait by his bedside for the results of a brain scan.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The latest batch of patients to be treated in the A&E department of London's King's College Hospital includes two with serious head injuries, one of whom, a Brighton female cyclist, has been airlifted to the building. Also brought in by helicopter is a father-of-four who fell from scaffolding as he repaired a roof, while other cases include former docker Bill, who has hurt his knee while drinking at his local working men's club.(n)

programme.title: The Mega Brothel
programme.desc: Documentary taking a look inside a brothel in Germany to explore what life is like for the women, clients and management in a country with some of the most liberal prostitution laws in the world. The high-end, five-storey Paradise club in Stuttgart is owned by Jurgen Rudloff, whose approach to attracting customers is to present the business as a spa for `the wellness of a man' with a sauna and steam room on offer.(n)

programme.title: A Very British Brothel
programme.desc: Documentary charting the day-to-day workings of a Sheffield massage parlour run by a mother and daughter, revealing the struggle to fill the daily rota and how management deal with problem clients. The programme also explores the lives of the women who advertise their services and for whom sex is just a job.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A man with schizophrenia is admitted for the 19th time in a year after failing to take his diabetes medication. Meanwhile, a former betting-shop manager and a 16-year-old both suffer suspected strokes - the 61-year-old, once known as the `memory man', is now coming to terms with his diminishing mental capabilities, while the teenager's identical twin and mother wait by his bedside for the results of a brain scan.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Actress Patsy Kensit, comedienne Sarah Millican, comedian Chris Ramsey and survivalist Bear Grylls join team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock to poke fun at some hot topics. Extended edition of the irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Cape Coral in Florida, where he tries to help Tim Morris and his partner Elaine find their dream waterfront property on a budget of £300,000.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Two-year-old Labrador Ira is fitted with a bionic spine, while anxious owner Rob brings in eight-year-old French bulldog Tom with a long list of chronic ailments. Matt and Rebecca arrive at the clinic with their three-year-old cat Marley, who may need to have a leg amputated.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Brigitte Tee, who runs four-star B&B Gorse Meadow in the New Forest, hosts the first round of the competition. Her guests are initially charmed by her eccentric personality, but the discovery of a bathroom window in need of repair and another room containing ladybirds, cobwebs and dust soon takes the shine off their stay.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants head to Lynton in north Devon, where they stay at Alistair and Emma Mundell's four-star Castle Hill Guesthouse. The pair only opened the B&B three months prior to the competition, and hope to impress with their recently renovated rooms, but Brigitte Tee proves hard to win over. Two of their guests are also forced to overcome their fears during a trip on a Victorian cliff railway.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves north to Blackpool and the three-star Vidella B&B run by John Downer and Neil Williams. The pair rig Blackpool-hater Alistair Mundell's room with practical jokes, and take their guests to Funny Girls drag cabaret bar, where Mark Crib confesses he has never had such a surreal time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Mark Crib welcomes the group to the Urban Beach in Bournemouth, Dorset, for the week's final B&B visit. The boutique establishment features chic rooms with deluxe bathrooms, and the guests approve of the afternoon's activity - a speedboat ride along the Jurassic coast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Brigitte Tee is upset to discover she has been given only one point for cleanliness and a heated exchange results in a walk-out, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple with very different ideas of how they want to spend their retirement seek advice from Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman. While husband Tony plans on returning to the Wirral in Merseyside, his wife Karin hopes to move to southern Spain, where her sister has already settled.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.sub-title: Rhyl, North Wales v Almeria, Spain.
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman meet a woman from Cheshire who has inherited a sum of money and wants to invest in a holiday rental property she and her family can also use. They help her decide between Rhyl in north Wales, which is close to her home, or Almeria in Spain, where income will potentially be higher and the sunshine more frequent.(n)

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Searching for Shakespeare's House: A Time Team Special.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team dig at the site of New Place, the home of William Shakespeare in Stratford-upon-Avon. The archaeologists hope to reveal that the house was once one of the largest in the area, with 20 rooms and a dozen servants, and explain why the Bard wanted such a grand place, and where he got the money to pay for it.(n)

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Time Team Special: Rediscovering Ancient Britain.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson explores the Dorset Ridgeway and investigates how the discovery of burial grounds, prehistoric monuments and a town built on top of an Iron Age hill fort have made the area one of the richest archaeological sites in the country. The team also explains how scientific advances have helped shed light on Britain's prehistoric civilisations.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Kevin and Natalie discover their beloved six-year-old German shepherd has a tumour. In desperation, they turn to Noel Fitzpatrick in the hope he can find a way to prolong Otto's life until their wedding day. The team also sees Jane, Simon and their Rottweiler puppy Elvis, who is having trouble walking, and seven-week-old Pomeranian Gucci, brought in with a broken paw by Amber and her two children after only 48 hours in her new home.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and mechanic Fuzz Townshend travel to Norfolk to help restore an ageing Ford Zodiac. They plan to help get its owner behind the wheel of his beloved motor for the first time in 20 years, but tensions rise when Fuzz opts to change the paintwork back to its original colour.(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood
programme.desc: An archer fighting in Richard the Lionheart's crusading army returns home to England and assumes the identity of a nobleman killed in battle. His new-found status draws him into a dangerous conflict with members of the newly crowned King John's court, and a traitorous knight plots to aid the French in conquering England. Ridley Scott's medieval adventure, starring Russell Crowe, Cate Blanchett and Mark Strong.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The stories of children and teenagers brought into A&E. A 16-year-old has suspected spinal injuries after being thrown from her horse and crushed against a fence, and consultant Jacqui Butler treats a four-year-old with a fishbone stuck in his tonsils from his lunchtime curry. Plus, a pregnant woman experiences intense pain following a sudden haemorrhage.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A builder falls at work and dislocates his shoulder in such an unusual way it takes a five-strong team to pull it into place. Alan, who is in his sixties and had one leg amputated in 2009, comes in with the other dangerously swollen following a holiday in Goa, and 83-year-old James has to be persuaded by senior sister AnnMarie to accept treatment for a cyst on his knee.(n)

programme.title: America the Wild
programme.desc: Grand Canyon Safari. Casey Anderson heads to the legendary Grand Canyon for an adventure of truly epic proportions. A trek through this vast wilderness that will take him from the California Condor to the Grand Canyon Rattlesnake and back again, as he profiles the rare and endangered wildlife living on the edge of the abyss. But as Casey discovers, by studying the signature Southwestern wildlife in a variety of ecological niches, there is a lot to be learned from their numerous physical and behavioral adaptations ? skills that he will try to put to good use along his grueling trek(n)

programme.title: America the Wild
programme.desc: Wolverine King. Bracing himself against the fierce elements in the frozen wilds of Alaska and British Columbia, Casey Anderson finds himself on his own mission impossible, a quest to find and film an elusive animal whose legend is almost larger than life, the Wolverine. Casey has the ability to forge a unique face-to-face bond with a captive-raised Wolverine named Jasper in Southeast Alaska. Pitting his own safety against the Wolverine?s ferocious reputation, Casey will get up-close and personal with Jasper to examine the key anatomical features of the Wolverine and assess their natural behaviors(n)

Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg.(n)

programme.desc: The chef heads north towards the Arctic Circle to explore the culinary delights of Reykjavik, coastal capital of Iceland. His aim is to enjoy the perfect winter break, enriched with a smorgasbord featuring the best ingredients the country has to offer - fjord-reared roast lamb, rye bread baked in volcanic sand and langoustine soup. Rick also resumes his search for the perfect cod.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Two semi-finalists work a shift in Nathan Outlaw's restaurant at the Capital hotel in Knightsbridge, central London, before the chef asks them to prepare one of his signature dishes - turbot cooked on the bone, served with deep-fried potatoes and capers, asparagus, peas, broad beans and a warm tartare sauce. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti, who pick one of them to go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Dubliners Tracey and Peter have been together six years after meeting online. Tracey is the organiser, Peter is the complete opposite, a laidback scatterbrain whose only loves in life - apart from his bride-to-be - are their two-year-old son and football. Now he gets the chance to prove his worth, but it proves a rocky road to the big day, with advice from a naked stranger and a dodgy wedding veil before they get to the reception at - where else? - the sports club.(n)

programme.desc: Domestic comedy, written by and starring comedian Jason Byrne as Tom Whyte, a man who approaches his duties as a dad with a huge dose of energy and enthusiasm - only to find disaster is never far away. Tom invites his neighbours over for a meal to apologise for an incident with the barbecue - but his hopes of a quiet evening quickly disappear when wife Karen starts knocking back the wine, best mate Roddy turns up unexpectedly and his parents descend on the house. And that's before the kids are sick on the trampoline. Pauline McLynn, Dermot Crowley, Michael Smiley and Karen Taylor co-star.(n)

programme.desc: For the 2012 BBC charity appeal, Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of a centre in Edinburgh for children with additional needs. The Yard is an indoor and outdoor centre that helps 1,500 youngsters and their families each week, providing a space where families can gain much-needed respite while their children make friends, develop their confidence and learn life skills. However the building is in urgent need of a complete overhaul, so the SOS builders are joined by local tradespeople giving their time for nothing to help this worthy cause.(n)

programme.desc: For the 2012 BBC charity appeal, Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of a centre in Edinburgh for children with additional needs. The Yard is an indoor and outdoor centre that helps 1,500 youngsters and their families each week, providing a space where families can gain much-needed respite while their children make friends, develop their confidence and learn life skills. However the building is in urgent need of a complete overhaul, so the SOS builders are joined by local tradespeople giving their time for nothing to help this worthy cause.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Million Pound Build for Children in Need 2013.
programme.desc: As part of the 2013 appeal, Nick Knowles and the team head to Peterborough to help Children in Need-funded organisation Little Miracles, which supports youngsters with disabilities and life-limiting illnesses and their families. However, whereas Mark, Chris, Julian and Billy normally renovate an existing property, for the first time they are knocking down a building and reconstructing it from the ground up - making it worth almost £1million. With just nine days to complete the job, they'll need help - and lots of it. Luckily, tradespeople turn out in force - from both the local area and across the country - giving their time for free.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Money Maker on the Merry-Go-Round.
programme.desc: A gory discovery under a playground roundabout presents the team with a challenging reconstruction task. Investigating the murder of a young financial trader, Booth and Aubrey focus on a wealthy hedge fund, uncovering a world rife with drugs, escorts, incriminating evidence and multimillion-dollar mistakes. The case dredges up painful memories for Aubrey, while competitive intern Oliver Wells gets under Brennan's skin.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Documentary series taking viewers inside the UK Border Agency, revealing the work that takes place behind the scenes of the immigration process. Teams at Heathrow Terminal 3, Calais, Dover and across the North West and North East of England reveal the methods and technology used to allow legitimate visitors safe passage while catching those who try to gain illegal entry to the UK.(n)
